Emeranda es una de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 29 años, estudios hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y es soltera, ella nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 10 años con el apoyo de sus padres abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para ganar un poco de dinero extra y no tener que salir a buscar trabajo fuera de su comunidad, Emeranda platica que cuendo inicio fue un poco dificil hacer clientes pero que ya tiene clientela que le hacen el gasto, a ella siempre le gusta tener bien surtida su tienda para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que busquen y vuelvan ha hacerle el gasto, ella a hecho crecer poco a poco su negocio y quiere este credito para invertirlo en la compra de  galletas, aceite, arroz, frijol, cremas, chiles enlatados, cafe, velas, cerillos, papel higienico, pasta dental, jabon, cloro, refrescos y dulces para resurtir su negocio.
ella desea que esta inversion haga crecer mas su negocio y atraiga mas clientes.

los demas integrantes de este grupo son:

Roque venta de abarrotes 
Filiberto venta de abarrotes 
Adrian venta de pan 
Esperanza venta de abarrotes
Julian venta de abarrotes
Daniela venta de abarrotes 
Guadalupe Costura 
Luz Elena Abarrotes
texts.en:
The “Los Caballeros” Group is composed of 9 persons, each with a different economic activity. All the members are known to be happy, friendly, and hard-working. They live in a community where there is a beautiful river with blue pearly water and many of its inhabitants are dedicated to collecting rubber, planting trees, and caring for their farm lands.

Emeranda is a member of this group. She is 29 years old, studied until the 3rd year of secondary school, and is single. She tells us that a little over 10 years ago, with her parents help, she opened a small grocery store, hoping to earn a little extra money and to avoid having to leave her community to look for work. Emeranda says that when she started out, it was a bit difficult to find customers but, now, she has enough clientèle to cover costs. 

She always likes to have a good assortment of merchandise in her store so that her customers always find what they are looking for, making it worthwhile to return. Emeranda has expanded her store little by little and will use this loan to purchase crackers, oil, rice, beans, creams, canned chiles, coffee, candles, matches, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, clorox, soft drinks, and sweets to restock her store. She wants this investment to encourage business growth and to attract more customers.

The remaining members of the group are:
Roque who sells groceries
Filiberto who sells groceries
Adrian who sells bread
Esperanza who sells groceries
Julian who sell groceries
Daniela who sells groceries
Guadalupe who is a dressmaker
Luz Elena who sells groceries

loans.use: buy cooking oil, rice, beans, creams, canned chiles, coffee, candles, matches, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, clorox, soft drinks, and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Gotitas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS DE ORO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ruth. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de abarrotes, venta de centros de polleras, venta de ropa, venta de artefactos, venta de comida.

La señora Ruth,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de de garrafa para cocinar) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración de sus productos los comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el seguro de vida.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Graciela ya que se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Droplets of Gold” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the Los Andes central office. It is made up of seven members and is led by a board of directors, headed by Ruth. There are many businesses that the members of the association help get started, including grocery stores, selling traditional skirts in malls, selling clothes, selling artifacts, and selling food. 

Ruth says that she has been working for Pro Mujer for two years and that she became a member of the institution at the invitation of a loan officer. Right now she has a business selling food, which she has been doing for years. 

The loan which she is taking out now is to increase her capital (purchase of carafes for cooking) that she will get from the bank and later for the making of her products, which she will sell at her place of work. This type of job allows her to make money to support her family. She lives in a shared living space and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loan and the life insurance. 

Graciela is not in the photograph because she had a doctors appointment.

loans.use: to purchase carafes.

loans.name: La Union (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La Union es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 personas alegres, amables y trabajadoras, cada una de ellas realiza una actividad economica para sacar adelante a su familia y tener cada dia una mejor vida, ellos viven en una zona cañera y la mayoria de los esposos se dedican al corte de caña en tiempo de zafra(cuando el ingenio azucarero esta en tiempo de producion).

La señora alejandra es uno de los miembros del grupo, ella tiene la edad 37 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y esata casada con el señor Dionicio, ella tiene dos hijos que asisten a la escuela en su comunidad. 

Doña Alejandra  platica que desde hace mas de 15 años inicio a trabajar vendiendo de todo un poco para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, pero hace algunos años inicio a vender hamburgesas y hot-dog los fines de semana en el parque de una comunidad cercana, ella dice que gracias a Dios vende bastante y con el paso del tiempo ha hecho muchos clientes a los cuales les gusta mucho su comida, lo que mas le ayuda es que frente al parque esta la iglesia y al terminar la misa la gente le hace el gasto, ella se encuentra muy contenta porque su negocio esta progresando y esto le ayudara a poder dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
ella invertira este credito en la compra de  carne, lechuga, tomate, chiles, cebolla, pan y refrescos.
Ella nos dice que a futuro le gustria invertir en algunas mesas y sillas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
florina manualidades
Alejandra venta de hot-dog y hamburguesas
 Odali venta de cosmeticos 
Silvia Venta de Antijitos Mexicanos
 Concepcion venta de cosmeticos 
Florencia venta de catalago 
Anabel venta de catalago 
Daniel taller mecanico 

NOta: Daniel no aparece en la foto pero sale su esposa
texts.en:
The Union is the name of a group made up of 8 happy, friendly, hardworking people. Each one of them has a job to get their family ahead and to make each day of their lives better. They live in an area of sugarcane production and the majority of their husbands make a living chopping cane during harvest (when the sugar mills are in a production period.)

Alejandra is one of the members of the group. She is 37 years old and studied until middle school. She is married to Dionicio and has two children that attend school in her community.   

Alejandra says that more than 15 years ago she began selling a little of everything to help her husband with household expenses, but several years ago she began selling hamburgers and hot dogs on weekends in the park of a nearby community. She says that thanks to God she sells quite a few and with the passing of time has made many customers who like her food a lot. What helps her the most is that the church is at the front of the park, and after mass people like to spend money. 

She has been very happy because her business is getting bigger and this will help her be able to give her family the best quality of life. 

She will put this loan towards the purchase of meat, lettuce, tomatoes, peppers, onions, bread and drinks. 

She told us that in the future she would like to invest in a few tables and chairs to give the best service to her customers. 

The other members of the group are:
Florina Manualidades
Alejandra: Hot dog and hamburger sales
Odali: Cosmetic sales
Silvia: Mexican antiques sales
Concepcion: Cosmetic sales
Florencia: Catalogue sales
Anabel: Catalogue sales
Daniel: Mechanic workshop

Note: Daniel isn't in the photo but his wife is.

loans.use: to buy meat, lettuce, tomatoes, peppers, onions, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en una de las compañías de la ciudad de Itá.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo hace más de 3 años, y gracias a esto puede ayudar con los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa. Ella comenta que su sueño es poder tener una tienda grande donde poder ofrecer mayor comodidad y variedad a sus clientes.
La señora Ana es muy responsable y profesional en su trabajo, busca siempre la excelencia en su actividad y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad recibida para compartir con todos su vida profesional.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo que podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Ana is from the city of Itá. She is 25 years old and lives at one of the companies in the city of Itá. 

She has made a living selling clothes of all kinds for more than 3 years, and thanks to this she can help with household costs that come up every day. She says that her dream is to be able to have a big store where she can offer the best in comfort and variety to her customers. 

Ana is very responsible and professional in her work. She always seeks excellence at her job and is grateful to the Paraguay Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity to share her professional life with everyone.

She is asking for the loan for the purchase of summer clothing so that she can satisfy the orders she has received.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to subsequently sell.

loans.name: Numidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Numidia, vive en la ciudad de Paraguarí, está casada con Ancelmo, tienen 2 hijas que están estudiando en la facultad la mayor tiene 23 años y la menor de 20 años.
Ella se dedica en la elaboración y venta de helados artesanales, hace aproximadamente 4 años Cuenta que le va muy bien en el negocio ya que siempre tiene muy buenas ventas. Comenta que empezaron con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias al trabajo en conjunto de toda la familia pudieron salir adelante y crecer.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de un congelador, ya que es muy importante este para su tienda de helados. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que le está dando.
texts.en:
Numidia lives in the city of Paraguarí. She is married to Ancelmo. They have 2 daughters in college. The oldest is 23 and the youngest is 20. 

She has been making and selling artisanal ice cream for 4 years. She says that the business is going very well for her since she always has good sales.  She remarks that they started with a small business, but thanks to the work they did together with the whole family they were able to get ahead and grow. 

She is asking for the loan to buy a freezer, since it is very important for her ice cream store. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her ice cream store.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery ha sido una persona que se ha visto marcada por la falta de oportunidades en su vida. Se ha capacitado como secretaria, sin embargo le ha sido muy difícil conseguir un empleo, por lo que decidió montar su negocio para poder aportar a los gastos del hogar y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Luz Mery tiene como su prioridad el mejorar la calidad de vida de sus 2 hijos, y poder brindarles la oportunidad de acceder a una buena educación. Luz Mery se dedica a atender su negocio de café Internet, y gracias a esto genera ingresos suficientes como para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Con el ánimo de hacer atractivo su negocio para los clientes, Luz Mery ha incluido en los productos y servicios que ofrece, el servicio de telefonía tanto nacional como internacional, servicio de impresiones, venta de dulces, entre otros más, y gracias a esto sus clientes se han identificado con el café Internet de Luz Mery. Actualmente, y como inicio de la temporada escolar, Luz Mery recibe muchos pedidos por parte de sus clientes de productos de papelería, sin embargo ella no tiene incorporado este producto entre los que vende. Es por esto que Luz Mery aspira a que un préstamo el permita acceder a la compra de productos de papelería como cuadernos, borradores, lapiceros, entre otros y poder así aumentar sus ventas y su nivel de ingresos.
Luz Mery sueña con que su negocio le pueda generar unos ingresos superiores a los que le genera actualmente, y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos. 
Además de esto, Luz Mery aspira a estudiar programación y reparación de computadores, y poder ofrecer este servicio a sus clientes para que así su negocio sea más atractivo y ella pueda satisfacer todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Luz Mery has had a life marked by a lack of opportunities. She is trained as a secretary but had a very hard time finding a job, so she decided to open up her own business to be able to cover her housing expenses and basic necessities for her husband and 2 children. Her top priority is to improve the quality of life for her kids and to be able to give them opportunities for a good education. 

Luz Mery has an internet cafe, and the income from this has been enough to cover their basic needs. With the goal of making her business more attractive for customers, she also offers services like national and international telephone calls, printing, and selling candies and other things. Because of this, her customers like her cafe. Luz Mery wants a loan to buy school products like notebooks, erasers, pencil cases and other things to increase her sales and income.

Luz Mery dreams of a business that makes more money so that she can have a better quality of life for her husband and 2 kids. She also wants to study computer repair and programming so that she can offer those services to her customers, making it more attractive, and to be able to satisfy all of her needs.

loans.use: to buy school supply products like notebooks, pencil cases, erasers and other things so that she can offer her customers more variety.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel es una señora de 40 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.
Desde hace varios años que Rosibel se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó como intermediaria con mercadería ajena y poco a poco ha ido haciendo sus propias prendas. Pero en estos momentos, le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  
Actualmente Rosibel está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones) para  darle mantenimiento a dicho negocio y comprar más ropa para que haya un incremento, ya que la demanda es grande. Su meta es tener un local en un futuro, donde se pueda instalar bien con sus mercaderia y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Rosibel es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Fuente Agrícola, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosibel, 40, lives with her family in La Fuente, in Cartago province.  The main water run-off system in this area is the Reventazon River, which starts up in the Cuericí mountain.  Because of the fertility of its land, due to its volcanoes and floodplains, Cartago is a town where agriculture and livestock production are the main economic activities.

Rosibel has been selling clothing for a number of years.  She started out as an intermediary selling merchandise from others, and gradually she has been making her own garments.  But at this time, she lacks the money to make her business expand, which would benefit the neighbors in her community.  So Rosibel is requesting a small loan of 600,000 Costa Rican colones to invest in her business and buy more clothing, since the demand is strong.  Her goal is to have a store in the future that she could fill with merchandise. This would allow Rosibel and her family to have a better quality of life.

Rosibel is a member of the "Fuente Agricola" communal bank, one of the 150 such organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue to grow, both at the personal and economic level.  In addition, she expects to participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

loans.use: with her business selling clothing

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: Marvin José es un empresario que su actividad a la que se dedica es a una farmacia que la tiene ubicada en su lugar de domicilio, ya tiene años de experiencia y la calidad de productos que le ofrece a sus clientes es bueno por tanto lo visitan. El ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con espíritu emprendedor perseverante. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de de medicamento en general que sus clientes más le buscan en su farmacia.
texts.en:
Marvin José is a businessman who has a pharmacy located in his home.  He has years of experience, and the quality of products he offers his customers is good, which is why they visit him so much.  He already has had a loan with Fundación León 2000 and showed himself to be a responsible person with a persevering entrepreneurial spirit.

Currently he is requesting a loan to invest in the business by buying medicine in general that his customers most look for in his pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy medicine in general.

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelina is one of the members of the Grupo La Buena Nueva 1, 2, y 3 (The Good New Group 1, 2, and 3), located in the city of Samana. This group is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and fruits and who also provide services including a Beauty salon, shoe repair, Motor taxi, etc. 

Marcelina is a businesswoman who lives with her husband and  their six children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to serve God. Marcelina is very excited to receive her 8th loan with Kiva partner Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her earlier loans, and with each one contributing to growing her business. She has had her business for about four years. She started it with the aim of making money and being useful and that is when she took her first Esperanza loan. She is planning to use her new loan to purchase different styles of clothing.  She plans to use her earnings to help her husband with extra income. Her dream is to have a successful business and a comfortable house. 

The group pictures are separated; these three pictures make the complete group of 15.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.es:
Gloria ha sido una persona que ha sufrido las consecuencias de la violencia, pues desde hace 7 años salió desplazada de su municipio natal y se debió instalar en su actual residencia. A pesar de todo esto, Gloria nunca ha desistido y siempre ha mantenido la lucha constante para salir adelante con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Para Gloria, sus 5 hijos son lo más importante, y es por ellos por los que todos los días trabaja fuertemente con el ánimo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y que en un futuro puedan acceder a una educación universitaria. 
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Gloria ha iniciado con un bajo capital su negocio de venta de papelería, y gracias a este ha podido obtener ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. En vísperas de la temporada escolar, Gloria requiere de surtir su negocio con una mayor mercancía para hacerlo atractivo para sus clientes, sin embargo, Gloria no posee el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía de papelería como son cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, cartulina, carpetas, entre otros productos, y poder así atender toda la demanda que se presenta en esta temporada.
Gloria espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente en esta temporada, y pueda así generar más ingresos para su hogar para mejorarles la calidad de vida a su esposo y sus 5 hijos, y también aspira a poder ahorrar lo suficiente como para brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible, y en un futuro el que puedan acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Gloria has suffered the consequences of violence.  Seven years ago, she moved out of her native town and had to settle in her current residence.  In spite of all this, Gloria has never given up and has always maintained a constant struggle to get ahead with her husband and five children.  For Gloria, her five children are the most important, and it is for them that she works hard every day with the purpose of giving them a better quality of life and the opportunity to attend college in the future.  

With the purpose of generating income to sustain her home, Gloria started her stationery shop with a small amount of capital, and thanks to this business, she was able to earn income to contribute to the household expenses.  Just before the school season, Gloria must stock her business with more merchandise to make it attractive to her customers.  Gloria doesn’t have enough capital to make these purchases, however, and so she is seeking a loan that offers her the opportunity to purchase merchandise for her stationery shop such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, cardboard, folders, and other products.  This will enable her to meet the demand that occurs during this season.

Gloria hopes that her sales will increase considerably during this season, and that this will enable her to generate more household income and improve the quality of life for her husband and five children.  Also, she plans to save enough money in order to offer her children the best education possible so that they may attend college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stationery goods such as notebooks, folders, cardboard, pencils, erasers, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to begin building a wall behind her house.

loans.name: Mano Amiga 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is the coordinator of her group Mano Amiga (Friendly Hand) 1, 2, 3 & 4, group comprised of 20 entrepreneurs from Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where they all run their businesses. Juliana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Juliana is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and Avon beauty products. She will purchase pants, shirts, skirts, creams, perfumes, and makeup in the capital and then bring her merchandise back to her community to sell. Some of her purchases are orders from clients, others she buys to sell.  She is saving to finish building her house and this is how she will use the profits. 

She is still dreaming of buying a scooter to make moving around with her merchandise easier and in order to travel to other communities. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Geovanny Gston

texts.es:
Geovanny de 36 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde pequeño le gusto ser ebanista por eso de joven comenzó como ayudante haciendo muebles. 

Poco a poco ha mejorado sus ingresos y ha podido construir un pequeño local donde tiene un negocio de ebanista. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo Madera y herramientas para hacer mas muebles y venderlos a un precio cómodo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Geovanny, 36, is a hard-working man who has wanted to be a cabinetmaker since he was a child. That's why as a young man, he started making furniture as a helper.

He has improved his income little by little, and has been able to build a small shop, where he has a cabinetmaking business.

He has many ambitions for his business. That's why he wants to buy wood and tools, to make more furniture to sell to his customers at an affordable price.

loans.use: To buy wood and tools.

loans.name: Canastitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Canastitas, está conformado por la señora Jacinta va a comprar con su préstamo zapatos, tenis y catálogos, el joven Antolín va a comprar herramienta gatos, dados, matracas para arreglar autos, la señora María de los Ángeles va a comprar vara, madera, clavos y barniz para la elaboración de canastos. La señora Jacinta tiene 40 años de edad, ella estudio hasta la secundaria, ella vive en unión libre, ella tiene una niña que estudia la primaria, ella vende zapatos por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar tenis y zapatos de dama y caballero para surtir sus pedidos. Ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años le ofrecieron vender por catalogo los zapatos y le enseñaron a vender, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinos en su comunidad, su negocio es importante porque va ganando y a ella le gusta vender, ella esta orgullose de su negocio se va ayudando para comprar para la comida o algo que falte en la casa, sus clientas son las jóvenes, señoras y maestras, su negocio es popular porque ya la conocen, ella está feliz con esta oportunidad porque este préstamo que va a recibir lo va a utilizar para comprar zapatos y darles a sus clientas mejor servicio. Sus sueños y esperanza son que crezca su negocio y sacar adelante a su hija que no le falte nada y que siga estudiando.  Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad gracias por prestarnos, esperamos crecer nuestros negocios y gracias por confiar en nosotros”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Canastitas." It consists of Señora Jacinta, who is going to use her loan to buy tennis shoes and shoes from catalogs; the young man Antolín, who is going to buy jacks, wrenches, and a ratchet set to repair cars; and Señora Maria de los Angeles, who is going to buy reeds, wood, nails, and varnish to make baskets. 

Señora Jacinta is 40 years old. She attended school up to the secondary level. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has a daughter who is in primary school. She sells shoes through catalog sales. She is applying for her loan to buy tennis shoes and men's and women's shoes to fill her orders. She began the business three years ago. They offered her the opportunity to sell shoes through catalog sales, and they taught her how to sell. She goes out to offer her products to her neighbors in the community. Her business is important because she is earning money, and she likes to sell. She is proud of her business, which helps her buy food or whatever is needed at home. Her customers are young women, married women, and teachers. Her business is popular because they already know her. She is happy to have this opportunity because the loan that she will receive is going to be used to buy shoes and give her customers better service. Her dreams and hope are that her business will grow and she can raise her daughter so that she does not lack for anything and can continue going to school. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for the loans,  we hope to grow our businesses, and thank you for having confidence in us."

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes and shoes for ladies, men, and children

loans.name: Ana Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz. Ella hace muchos años se graduó de modista en una academia de la ciudad.
 
Doña Ana tiene un taller de costura en su casa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, aunque lo que más le gusta es  confeccionar ropa niñas y niños,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 pero a veces se queda trabajando hasta más tarde cuando tiene mucho trabajo que hacer. Lleva más de 12 años dedicada a esta actividad y gracias a Dios no le falta el trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros  materiales para la costura. Lleva 4 años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que le ha brindado la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un taller de costura más grande y más industrializado.
texts.en:
The members of the "Las Divinas" communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California residential complex in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province. Portoviejo has been known for many years as, "The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees." 

This is where we met Ana. She is 46, married, and has a child who is now an adult and independent. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Some years ago, she graduated in dressmaking from an academy in the city.

Ana has a sewing workshop in her home, and makes all kinds of clothing; though what she likes best is making children's clothing. She works every day from 8:00am to 8:00pm, but sometimes she stays working until much later, when she has a lot of work to do. 

She has been in this occupation for more than 12 years, and fortunately has no lack of work.

This loan is to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.  

She has been in the communal bank for four years, and likes it because of the the help and benefits that the institution offers her. Her dream is to have a larger and more mechanized sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Los Guadalupes Group

texts.es:
Edgar cuenta con 22 años de edad, es casado su esposa se llama wendy tiene dos hijos Yoselin de 4 años y un bebe de dos meses  aun no tiene nombre, el es albañil ya tiene un año desempeñando ese trabajo, dice que pondrá un negocio e invertirá su préstamo en un taller de bicicleta espera que le ayude su préstamo ya que dice le pondrá todo de su parte para que su taller salga adelante.

Edgar pertenece al grupo "los Guadalupe" el cual esta integrado por 5 hombres y 6 mujeres a continuación serán mencionados: Felipe, Fermín, Mario, Rosa, Roció, Inés, Oscar, Edgar, Luz Divina, Romelia, Celedonia, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de tamales, pescados, taller de bicicletas, ropa, verduras, pan, etc.
texts.en:
Edgar is 22 years old and married.  His wife is named Wendy.  He has two children, Yoselin, 4, and a two-month-old baby who does not have a name yet.  He is a bricklayer and has been doing this work for a year.

He says he will set up a business and invest his loan in a bicycle repair shop.  He hopes his loan will help him because he says he will put everything he has into it so his shop will get ahead.

Edgar belongs to Los Guadalupes Group, which has these five men and six women: Felipe, Fermín, Mario, Rosa, Roció, Inés, Oscar, Edgar, Luz Divina, Romelia, and Celedonia.  They all work in commercial activities such as selling tamales, fish, bicycle shop, clothing, vegetables, bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and materials for bicycles.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

Aquí conocimos a Mayra tiene 19 años  de edad y está soltera, estudia Auditoria en una Universidad en la ciudad de Manta. Vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Ella además de estudiar también trabaja en sociedad con su mamá, ellas tienen una pequeña copiadora/papelería en su casa en la cual vende  útiles escolares y dan el servicio de copiado, allí trabaja en las tardes y noches ya que en las mañanas tiene que ir a su universidad, en la mañana su mamá se encarga del negocio.  Ellas llevan  con este negocio dos años en los cuales les ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es una parte para comprar útiles escolares para el negocio y también para pagar gastos de sus estudios. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños terminar sus estudios y tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
The Las Divinas Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the town of La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi and known as the city of real tamarinds. 

Mayra, 19 and single, studies accounting at a university in the city of Manta. She lives with her parents. 

Along with keeping up with her studies, she partners with her mother to run a small stationery store out of their house. There they sell school supplies and make copies. Mayra works in the afternoons and evenings, and while she attends class in the morning her mother runs the store. They started the business two years ago, and it has been successful so far. 

A portion of this loan will be used to purchase school supplies for their business, and a portion will be spent on Mayra's school expenses. She has been with the community bank for five loans and is the officer in charge of rules and regulations. She likes all the help she receives from the institution. 

Her dreams are to finish her studies and run a great business.

loans.use: purchase school supplies and pay for university

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es: Doña Ruperta tiene 68 años de edad y está casada con el señor Fidel los cuales tuvieron 4 hijos pero ya todos están casados y viven solos. Desde hace mas de 5 años doña Ruperta se dedica a vender y a criar borregos en su comunidad y comenta que empezó con este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que gana su esposo como jornalero no le alcanza para los gastos de la casa. Ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de 5 borregos y comprarles alimento para que crezcan más sanos y le urge comprarlos porque en el mes de diciembre es cuando mejores ventas tiene por que las gentes de su población hacen fiestas grandes por la temporada navideña. Dice que uno de sus  propósitos es hacer un nuevo corral donde sus animales puedan estar protegidos de las inclemencias del clima para que no se le enfermen. Comenta doña Ruperta que está muy contenta por trabajar con la financiera por que así su negocio crece y así pueden comer un poco mejor su esposo y ella.
texts.en: Ruperta is 68 years old and lives with her husband Fidel. They have four adult children. For more than five years Ruperta has worked selling and raising sheep in her town. She began this business to help her husband because his earnings as a day laborer were not enough to cover their household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase five sheep and the animal feed needed to keep them healthy. She hopes to purchase them soon because December is the best month for selling sheep because the people in her town have large parties during the Christmas season. One of her plans is to build a new corral where her animals will be protected from the bad weather, so they do not fall ill. Ruperta is very happy working with the bank because it can help her grow her business, and she and her husband can eat a little better.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo tiene 52 años de edad y está casado con la señora Otilia la cual se dedica al hogar, desde hace dos años se dedica a la crianza de borregos y vacas y dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque sus papas desde muy pequeño le inculcaron el amor por los animales y por la tierra. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para comprar borregos ya que en el mes de diciembre es cuando mejores ventas tiene por las fiestas navideñas. También comprara vacunas para que no se le enfermen y para alimento para sus animalitos. El está muy contento porque si le dan el crédito él podrá tener más animales para vender ya que se vienen las buenas ventas, también platica que una de sus metas es seguir echándole ganas y comprarse una camioneta de uso para así facilitarle el traslado de los animales ya que muchas veces no se los compran por que no tiene como trasladarlos a donde los quieren comprar. Dice que gracias a la financiera poco a poco a crecido su rebaño y eso lo tiene contento porque  quiere decir que  si ha hecho buen uso de los créditos que le han otorgado.
texts.en: Gustavo is 52 years old, and he lives with his wife Otilia. For the last two years he has worked raising sheep and cattle, and he says he enjoys his job because at a young age his parents taught him to love animals and the land. He will use the loan to purchase sheep because sales are the highest during the month of December because of the Christmas celebrations. He will also use the money to vaccinate his animals and to purchase animal feed. He is very pleased to receive this loan because it will allow him to sell more animals during the busiest season. One of his goals is to purchase a used pickup truck to transport the animals. On several occasions he has been unable to make sales because he has no way to transport the animals to where his clients are. He is thankful for the support from the bank because his flock is growing little by little, and this is proof that he has been using the loan money well.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep and cattle

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Oli como de cariño le dicen tiene 37 años de edad y está casada con el señor Santos el cual trabaja en la construcción en el país vecino, tiene dos niños los cuales estudian la primaria, dice que su esposo tuvo que  emigrar a otro país porque lo que ganaba en su localidad no le alcanzaba  entonces con los ahorros que él le manda ella empezó el negocio de la cría y venta de borregos para así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños y así hacerles poco a poco una casa ya que antes vivían en una de madera y les entraba el frio y seguido se le enfermaban ya que abeces caen fuertes heladas en su localidad. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para comprar un poco más de borregos ya que en el mes de diciembre y enero tienen mejores ventas de este tipo de animales por las fiestas navideñas, también quiere comprar alimento y vacunas para que  no se le enfermen los animales. La meta que tiene Olivia es tener un gran rebaño para cualquier emergencia que tenga pueda vender algún animalito y no estarse preocupando por conseguir dinero.
texts.en: Oli, as her friends call her, is 37 years old. Her husband Santos works in construction in a neighboring country. They have two children in elementary school. She said her husband had to immigrate to another country because what he could earn locally was not enough to provide for the family. The money he has sent home has allowed her to start a business raising and selling sheep. The business has allowed her to improve her children's lives. She has been building a house little by little; they used to have a wooden house, but the cold entered the house and they frequently got sick. She will use the loan to purchase sheep because the highest demand is in December and January during the Christmas season. She will also buy vaccines and animal feed for her animals. Olivia's goal is to have a large flock, so that if there is an emergency she can sell and animal instead of worrying about how to find the money.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep

loans.name: Raissa Rhamila

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

Aquí conocimos a Raissa tiene 21 años de edad, está soltera y estudia Jurisprudencia en una Universidad de la localidad. Vive en casa de sus padres. Para ella este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras del grupo son muy unidas o responsables.
 
Ella se dedica a sus estudios y a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en la  universidad donde ella estudia, sus compañeras de clases son sus mejores clientes las mismas que  le realizan muchos pedidos. Trabaja todos los días ya que los fines de semana también sale a recorrer por su localidad para venderles a sus amigos y conocidos. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil o Portoviejo dependiendo de lo que necesite. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños, también es para gastos de sus estudios.

Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the members of Las Divinas Community Bank meet in the city of La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, known as the city of real tamarinds.

Raissa is 21 years old; she is single and studies law at a local university. She lives with her parents. This will be her second loan with the community bank, and she likes it because the other group members are united and responsible.

She studies and has a business selling clothing of all kinds. She makes her sales door-to-door and at the university where she studies. Her classmates are her best clients and make many orders. Raissa works every day, even going around town on the weekends to sell to friends and acquaintances. She purchases her clothes in Guayaquil or Portoviejo depending on what she needs. She has been selling clothes for a year, and she is doing well.

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise like: pants, shirts, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She will also use a portion of the loan for her school expenses.

Her dream is to complete her studies and become a successful professional.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y pagar sus gastos de estudios.

loans.name: Frank John

texts.es:
Frank tiene 30 años de edad vive en la ciudad de mala, ubicada al sur de nuestra capital, como buen peruano le gusta mucho nuestra comida, pero el platillo que le gusta más es el riquísimo Arroz con pollo, el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, debido a que sus padres no contaban con los medios económicos suficientes pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Administración de Empresas.

Frank trabaja de sol a sol como decimos en Perú, el se dedica a su negocio de venta de abarrotes, pero también a la venta de productos de ferretería, el es una persona mil oficios y es que si es un trabajo honrado porque no realizarlo, trabaja alrededor de 13 horas diarias sin parar, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios está a su lado y es el único que lo guía por el buen camino y también porque atiende a los clientes de manera amable.

Frank está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el tener mayores  podrá tener mayores ingresos para mejorar  su calidad de vida y darle lo mejor a su hijo, así como también seguir ahorrando para poder  seguir creciendo y para cumplir su gran sueño:” Crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Frank is 30 years old. He lives in the city of Mala, located to the south of our capital. Like a good Peruvian he very much likes our food, but the dish he enjoys the most is the rich rice with chicken. He only studied until the 5th grade of elementary school since his parents didn’t have enough money, but he very much would have liked to study Business Administration. 

Frank work from sun-up to sun-down, as we say in Peru. He works in his business selling groceries, but he also sells hardware. He is a jack of all trades, and if it’s honest work why not do it? He works 13 hours non-stop. He believes that things are going well with his business because God is on his side, and only God can lead him on the right path. Also, Frank tends to his customers in a friendly way. 

Frank is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since that to their help he will be able to have more income to improve his quality of life and give the best to his son. Also, he can continue saving in order to keep growing and be able to achieve his greatest dream: “Grow as a small business.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries)

loans.name: Dolores Carlina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en una escuela para niños especiales. Su esposo es chofer de un gerente en la ciudad de Manta.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus hijos y su esposo se dedica a elaborar bisutería y adornos para fiestas elaborados en fomix, estas manualidades aprendió hace muchos años y ahora elabora estos productos y los envía hasta los Estados Unidos donde tiene familiares quienes la dan vendiendo. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta profesión y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales útiles para elaborar sus manualidades como perlas, mullos, cadenas, broches, fomix, silicón, etc. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en el transcurso de este tiempo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
In the residential area La California in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the communal bank Las Divinas meet every fifteen days. 

Here we meet Dolores. She is 42 years old and married, and she and her husband have 3 children aged 16, 14, and 11 years old. The two oldest study in high school, and the youngest in a school especially for children. Her husband is a chauffeur for a businessman in the city of Manta. 

In order to earn something of her own and to help her children and her spouse, she works decorating jewelry and ornaments with craft foam for parties. She learned this craft many years ago, and now  she makes those products and sends them to the United States where she has family members who sell them. She’s been doing this work for over 20 years, and it’s going very well. 

This loan is to buy materials used to make her crafts like pearls, beads, chains, broaches, craft foam, silicon, etc. She’s been with the communal bank for 5 years, and she like the help they’ve given her during this time. 

Her dreams are to keep advancing her business and that her children don’t lack anything.

loans.use: to buy pearls, beads, chains, broaches, craft foam, silicon, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario de 30 años es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta emprender nuevos retos, el es comerciante desde hace mucho tiempo, el inicio ayudando a su padre con el negocio sobre ruedas de venta de accesorios, bolsas, maquillajes en la plaza principal. Cuando Mario comenzó a formar su propia familia y vio que los gastos eran mayores, fue que  pensó hace 8 años en iniciar su propio negocio que fuera de venta de chicharrones, papas, churros, rusas y frutas. El negocio como es comercio sobre ruedas lo instalo en otra ciudad y por la delincuencia le robaron su camioneta y se tuvo que regresar a esta ciudad en camión. Para él es muy importante en este momento surtir su negocio ya que tuvo algunos gastos a causa del robo y se quedo sin capital para surtirlo, ya que el negocio es su fuente de ingresos para sostener los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mario, 30, is a very hard-working man who likes to develop new goals.  He has been in business for a long time and he started, by helping his father with street market sales of accessories such as purses and cosmetics in the main square.  8 years ago when Mario began forming his own family and he saw that expenses were higher, he began his own business of selling chicharonnes (fried pork skins), potatoes, churros (a long fried pastry), juices, and fruit.  He set up the business in another city but because of the crime there, his van was stolen and he had to return home by bus.  

It is very important for him now to supply his business since he had additional expenses because of the robbery and he was left without capital to stock up.  The business is the source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy chicharrones (fried pork skins), cups, soft drinks, and more

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis es un joven muy trabajador y que no le gusta depender de nadie, hace años el comenzó con su negocio de venta de comida pero como estaba en lugar donde la renta era muy elevada sus ganancias eran muy pocas y no le convino. Aparte de ese negocio el siempre se dedico al estilismo, trabajos que solo realizaba en sus ratos libres, pero al ver que no le quedaba de otra se dedico completamente al negocio de belleza desde hace 7 años, en el que le está funcionando muy bien. Los trabajos que realiza es corte de cabello, colocación de extensiones, uñas, tintes, mechas y peinados. En este momento requiere de un préstamo para comprar material para uñas, broches, tintes, peróxido y mas, de esta manera el tendrá suficiente material para poder realizar sus trabajos.
texts.en: Jose Luis is a hardworking young man who doesn't like to depend on anyone. Some years ago he started a business selling food, but he was in a place where the rent was very high and so he didn't have a lot of profit, which wasn't working for him. Aside from that business, he has always worked as a stylist in his free time, so seven years ago when he realized that the other business wasn't going to make it he decided to dedicate himself fully to the beauty business. It's going very well for him. He gives hair cuts, extensions, nails, hair coloring, highlights and hair styling. Right now he needs a loan to buy materials for nails, hair clips, dyes, peroxide and other things so that he will have enough supplies to be able to do his job.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for his business.

loans.name: Diana Janeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Diana, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  8 y 3 años de edad el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se  dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas, deja sus productos  a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Este negocio empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace dos años y le gusta la ayuda que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte the members of the communal bank La Unión Hace La Fuerza (Unity is Strength) meet twice a month. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the locals and are recognized throughout the country.

In this place we meet Diana, who is 26 years old, married and from this relationship she has two children who are 8 and 3 years of age and the oldest attends school. Her husband is a merchant.

Besides being a housewife she also sells all kinds of clothing. She sells door to door and also sells from her home where she has a little store. She works three days a week mostly in the mornings. She leaves her products on credit and collects every fifteen days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever it is necessary. She began this business with the first loan that she received from the bank and is doing very well.

She is going to use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and children’s clothing. She has been in this communal bank since it began two years ago and she likes the help that she receives from the institution. 

Her dreams are to get ahead and to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: La señora Zulma es una mujer muy trabajadora  que la mayoría del día se la pasa fuera de su casa, como es divorciada y tiene un hijo como de 12 años se preocupa por su bienenestar. Zulma observando en la situación que está en el país con tanta delincuencia se preocupa por el patrimonio que será para su hijo. Por lo que pensó en instalar protecciones en las ventanas de su casa para brindar a su familia mayor seguridad y de esta manera cuidar sus cosas que con mucho esfuerzo ah comprado. Para realizar su proyecto necesita capital para comprar las protecciones y pagar la instalación; de esta manera ella se irá a su trabajo sin pendiente.
texts.en:
Zulma is a very hard-working woman, who spends the majority of the day away from home, as she is divorced, and has a 12-year-old son whose well-being is her concern. As Zulma looks at the situation in the country, with so much crime, she is concerned about what she will be able to pass on to her son. 

So she thought about installing bars on the windows of her home, to offer her family greater security, and in this way take care of her possessions, that she has bought with much effort. 

To carry out her project, she needs capital to buy the security bars, and pay for installation. This way, she will leave for work without worrying.

loans.use: To install security bars on her windows.

loans.name: Doris Leticia

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer muy luchadora es madre de 2 pequeños cuyas edades comprenden 12 y 7 años, el mayor cursa el primer grado de secundaria y el menor se encuentra cursando el primer grado de primaria, Doris como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida pero en especial su debilidad es el riquísimo platillo llamado  “Carapulcra con sopa Seca”, Doris solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria porque sus padres no tenían los económicos suficientes por ello ella lucha cada día porque sus hijos salgan adelante ya que ella quiere que sean mejores que ella.

Doris trabaja actualmente en la venta de Vino, le dedica a sus trabajo 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes por día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy amable con sus clientes y le ofrece un producto de calidad, así como también porque tiene lo más valioso que una persona puede tener que son los hijos.

Doris está muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería (vino) para poder tener un mejor inventario y con ello tener más variedad de productos, con esta mejora ella podrá tener más ingresos y con ello una mejor calidad de vida y seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:2 Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Doris is a determined woman.  She is the mother of two small children who are 12 and 7 years old.  The older one is enrolled in his first year of secondary school, and the younger one is in his first year of elementary school.  Doris, like a good Peruvian, really likes our food, but her particular weakness is the tasty dish called "Carapulcra con sopa seca" [Dried potatoes with meat and sauce and a side of pasta and vegetable soup].  Doris only studied through the fifth year of secondary school, because her parents did not have enough money to pay for it.  She fights every day because she wants her children to move ahead and to be better-off than her.

Doris currently works as a wine salesperson.  She spends 9 hours working per day, and she can help up to 10 customers each day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is very kind to her customers and offers them a quality product.  Also, she has the most valuable thing that a person can have: her children.

Doris is very happy and thankful for the Kiva loaners since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise (wine) to be able to have a better inventory and also have more variety in her products.  With this improvement, she will be able to have more income, a better quality of life, and continue saving to fulfill her biggest dream: giving an occupation to her children.

loans.use: buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora  Fidelina   vive en una localidad pequeña  en donde siempre hay  una temperatura calorosa, ella en viudo hace tres meses en la que ya no tiene hijos a su responsabilidad.
 
    Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  mercancía para surtir su  negocio  de abarrotes,  en donde lleva trabajando  dos años seis meses en la que comenta que le va bien.

    Ella inicio esta actividad ya que también quiere  apoyar   con los ingresos de la casa y mejorar cada día  sus ingresos para su hogar.
 
     Lo que ella desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir adelante   a hora que ya está sola  solo con el apoyo de sus   hijos.
texts.en:
Fidelina lives in a small town where the temperature is always hot. She became a widow three months ago. She no longer has any children in her charge.

She requested the loan to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store. She has been working in this business for 2.5 years and she says it is going well.

She started this business because she wanted to help with the household income and improve the family income.

Her wish is that with this business she will be able to continue working now that she is alone, though with the support of her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store

loans.name: Maria Belgica

texts.es:
La  señora  María Bélgica  vive en una  colonia pequeña ella es casada con el señor  Dionisio y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes ya todo están casados.

     Ella invertiría el préstamo en la compra de  útiles escolares para su papelería en donde lleva trabajando  dos años diez meses en donde comenta que  le va bien  ya que ha  mejorado mucho sus negocios.

      Inicio por si sola ya que con ello apoyaría a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  y así poder sacar a adelante su pequeña familia que es lo más importante para ella.
 
       Lo que mas desea es que con su actividad y el préstamo pueda seguir aumentado mas  sus  compra  para darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Bélgica lives in a small neighborhood. She is married to Sr. Dionisio with whom she has had four children who are all now married.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of school supplies for her stationary store which she has had for two years, ten months. She notes that it has been doing well since she has greatly improved her business.

She started her business herself since with it she would support her husband with household income and therefore be able to move her small family forward which is most important to her.

What she wants most is that with her business and the loan she will be able to continue increasing her purchases in order to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for her stationary store.

loans.name: Elizabeth Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elizabeth, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 3 y el menor de un año y 8 meses, la mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de electrónica.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo de Avon y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos  días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, aunque se le hace difícil a ella le gusta realizar sus recorridos y en la actualidad tiene que llevar a sus dos hijos más pequeños ya que no tiene donde dejarlos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.

En la fotografía está la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the village bank La Union Hace la Fuerza meet every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place known for delicious sweets made by the locals and recognized throughout the country.

Here we meet Elizabeth, 28, who is married and has 3 children, ages 10, 3 and almost 2. Her oldest is in school. Her husband has an electronics workshop.

She is a housewife who is also a saleswoman. She sells products from Avon and Sayson catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works two or three hours every day, although it's hard for her to make door-to-door sales because she has to take her two youngest with her since she doesn't have anywhere to leave them. She sells items on credit and collects payments every 8 days. She has been doing this for 8 years and it's going very well. Her most popular products are perfumes and cosmetics because they're very good.

She will use this loan for perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry. This is her third cycle with the village bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have a boutique. 

She is pictured here with her son.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a married woman with three children. Ma. Glenda is 27 years old, residing in Baliango, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Ma. Glenda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for two years. She earns 1,500 PHP each month from it. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2010, Ma. Glenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ma. Glenda wants to fund her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is from Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Nina is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Nina runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products used in the local community. Nina has been in her business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nina is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Nina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Eusebio Eraclio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 50 años, pero él tiene el espíritu de un joven de 20, el vive en la ciudad de Ica, tierra generosa caracterizada por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año; Eusebio está casado y junto a su esposa tienen 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 22, 24, 19, 15, todos ellos estudian y con mucho esfuerzo tanto de el cómo de su esposa los saca adelante y actualmente están estudiando en la universidad salvo el menor de todos que cursa el cuarto año de educación secundaria; como buen peruano ama nuestra comida sobre todo su patillo preferido es el “Tallarín Saltado”, Eusebio estudio Música y no solo por ser una carrera, sino también porque le apasiona.

Eusebio se dedica actualmente a tocar música en el cementerio de nuestra ciudad, su fiel aliado en su negocio es su acordeón , con el cual toca infinidad de melodías, el trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias, depende de la cantidad de personas que concurren el camposanto, y el motivo por el que lo hacen, el nos comenta que es muy conmovedor ver a las personas enterrando a sus familiares 	o recordando los años de su fallecimiento pero él siente que con su música puede aliviar en parte el dolor y la tristeza que ellos sienten, en ocasiones el ha llorado mientras tocaba su música, pero la vida continua y hay que seguir adelante, el cree que por la sensibilidad que él tiene le va bien en su negocio porque comprende la pena y el dolor por el que pasan los clientes y por ello tiene trabajo.

Eusebio está muy feliz y muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar los trámites para tener su título de profesor de Música, con esta mejora el podrá enseñar música y con ello obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, así como también ahorrar para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” que sus hijos sean profesionales y formar un negocio de Ganadería”
texts.en:
Eusebio is 50, but has the spirit of young man of 20. He lives in the city of Ica, a generous land noted for its warm climate at any time of year. Eusebio is married, and he and his wife have four children, ages 22, 24, 19, and 15.  All are in school, and with a lot of effort on the part of both he and his wife, he is helping them get ahead in life. Currently they are at university, except for the youngest, who is in fourth year of secondary education. 

As a good Peruvian, he loves our cooking, especially his favorite dish, "Tallarín Saltado" (noodles sauteed with tomatoes, onions, and soy sauce). 

Eusebio studied Music, not only as a career, but also because it is his passion.

At the present time, Eusebio plays music in our city's cemetery. His faithful ally in his business is his accordion, with which he plays countless melodies. He works around six hours daily, depending on the number of people who come to the cemetery. 

The reason he does it, he tells us, is that it is very moving to see people burying their family members, or remembering the year of their passing. But he feels that with his music he can aleviate in part, the pain and sadness that they feel. Sometimes he has cried while he was playing his music, but life goes on, and one has to move forward. 

He thinks that because of the sensitivity he has, it is going well for him in his business; he understands the pain and suffering that his customers are going through, and that is why he has work. 

Eusebio is very happy, and very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to undetake the paperwork necessary to obtain his certification as a music teacher. With this step forward, he will be able to teach music, and so earn greater income to improve his quality of life. As well, he will be able to save, so that he will be able to fulfill his great dream: "That his children become professionals, and to start a livestock business."

loans.use: To pay processing costs for his certification as a music teacher.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, is married and a mother of two children. She 35 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helen used her last loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Juvy is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Juvy runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products used in the local community. Juvy has been in her business for  three years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Juvy is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma, is married with four children. Delma is 58 years old, residing in Bunawan, Calamba Mis. Occ., Philippines. Delma owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years, and she earns 1,500 PHP a month from it. 

She requested a loan of 4,600 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Delma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Delma wants to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Lusot, Baliangao in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 55 years old, married and has six children. She plants, harvests, and sells rice for a living, earning 3,500 PHP from her farming.

In 2010 Aida became a member of GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Aida hopes to increase her harvest so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 42 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran in Misamis Occidental Province. He is married with three children. Romeo has a general store where he earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Romeo has been a member of PMPC for two years. He has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for his store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his store.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is from Lusot, Baliangao in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 67 years old, married and has six children. She plants, harvests, and sells rice for a living, earning 3,500 PHP a month from her farming.

In 2010 Florida became a member of GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old and resides in Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and has five children. 

Raquel owns farmland and operates a business, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living.  She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2010, Raquel joined GDMPC on order to gain access to financial services to help improve both her business and her living situation.  In the future, Raquel wants to make improvements to her house and increase her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is 42 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia.  She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over 10 years and enjoy successful careers growing rice and fishing.  Additionally, her husband is a motor taxi driver and one of her children is a dealer in the casino. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Savy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi.  The purchase of a new motorbike would allow her husband to attract more customers and earn more money to support the family.  

In the future, she would like to purchase piglets to breed and sell for a profitable price once they gain weight.  In addition, she plans to build a new house and support her children while they study to earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as motor taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products for her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 53 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City.  She is married and has two children. 

Juanita operates a sari-sari store, or general store, and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.  She has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to purchase more items to stock her general store. 

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more items to stock her general store.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 39, is married, resides with her mother, her grandmother, her husband and her four children in Banteay Mean Chey Province, Cambodia.  She is a tailor.  Her husband is a goods carrier who carries goods from the truck to store in the warehouse.  One of her children is employed in the RACHA organization. 

Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 500 to pay for her child’s school fees.  By doing so, her child would be able to finish their university degree and find a job to make money to support the family.  In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. Nora used her last loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Her business has grown and become successful.

Now she's taking a new loan to pay for services to increase crop yield. This new loan will be used in her other type of business. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow up her business.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ms. Ty is taking a loan out for her  son Mung, a student who is studying at Hanoi College for Informatics and Technology. His tuition duration has lasted for 5 years. He will graduate in 2013 with an engineering degree. With the hope of finding a good job, he is studying hard to absorb knowledge.

During his studying, he is confronted with a lot of difficulties in paying fees and buying other supplies. That is why his mother wants to borrow a loan of 7,290,000 Vietnamese dong to solve them.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and other supplies

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet, 48, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Banteay Mean Chey Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. Two of her children are employed as garment workers in Thailand.

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Chet is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase fertilizer to use for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra income from her agricultural business in the dry season to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business, renew her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 60 years old with 5 children. She lives in D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Evangeline is providing a recycling service business to local members to make a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old and lives in Minlasag, Sibutad. She is married with 4 children.

Evelyn has a small scale mining business and earns approximately 4,300 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase a horse.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Juanito, an electronics technician. They have two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every-day expenses.                             

Loreta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, with groceries, toiletries and beverages. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Loreta hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
