* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products for her store.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is married with 5 children. She is 60 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. Andresa runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4500. She has requested a loan of 14000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Andresa has been a member of PMPC for more than a year.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: San Sok

texts.en: San Sok, 48, is widowed and lives with her six children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for over six years and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice, pineapple and fattening up cattle. Three of her children are employed — two in a mobile company and another in sales. In order to improve her family's living conditions, San Sok is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to carry her products to the market and also for family transportation. In the future, she would like to expand her business by growing more pineapples in her farmland. In addition, she would like to build a new house and support her children's studies until they get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her agricultural products to sell at the market

loans.name: Jeanylyn

texts.en:
Jeanylyn is a married wirh three children. She is 25 years old, and lives in Lusot, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.: Philippines. 

Jeanylyn own and operate a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 4,000. She requested a loan of 7,000.00 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Jeanylyn  joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa is from Lusot, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is 40 years old, married with five children. Ma. Teresa plants, harvests, and sells rice for their living. Every month she earns 8,500. She became a member of GDMPC in 2010. She requests a loan of 30,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Ma. Teresa hopes to earn more to finance their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosemarie Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and lives in Mabini, Baliangao. She is married and has 4 children. 

Rosemarie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP24,900 to purchase a fishing boat for her fishing business. Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. 

Rosemarie is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for fishing.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 48, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is a widow, and mother to four children. Together with her children, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the everyday expenses of the family.

Rosemarie operates a dried fish retailing business. What she basically does is buy dried fish from wholesalers, then she repacks them and sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from dried fish to dried anchovies and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosemarie dreams to expand her store and help her children through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of dried fish products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Angelita is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Angelita is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Angelita has been in her business for 6 years and earns 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Angelita is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Angelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 38 years old with 5 children. She lives in D'ban Calamba Mis. Occ.: Philippines. 

Concepcion is providing a recycling services business to local members to make a living and she's been 4 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP1,200.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP4,000.00 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2010, Concepcion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for the business improvements.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 48 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and has 6 children. 

Fely works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 7 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Fely has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is married with three children. Lucena is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lucena is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of fertilizer. 

Lucena has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 72 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. She is married with four children. 

Arsenia has a general store and earns approximately PHP 3500 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 6000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Arsenia has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, 46, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been a construction foreman for over ten years and is successful in his career. Additionally, he is a motor taxi driver. His wife is a gardener. One of his children is employed as a construction worker. 

In order to improve his business, Sary is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more construction materials for use in his construction work. By doing so, he could run his business smoothly and generate more income for his family.  In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more construction materials for his construction work.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with two children. Thelma is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga.

To earn a living, Thelma engages in manicure/pedicure business. She has requested a loan of 34,000 PHP to purchase equipment for her beauty salon. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3900. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en:
Jordan is single and he is 21 years old. He resides at Panta-on, Ozamis City, Philippines.

Jordan is operating a business venture raising crops to earn a living and has been 5 years in this business. Each month, he earns 2,300 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 4,750 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In the year 2008, Jordan became a partner of GDMPC. In the future, Jordan wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Sok Heng, 29, is married and resides with her mother, her husband, and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetables vendor. Her husband has been running a business of buying cattle to sell for a profitable price for over three years and is successful in his career. 

In order to improve her family's economy, Sok Heng is requesting a loan of USD 800 to raise capital for her husband’s business in order to purchase more cattle to resell. By doing so, her family income would increase. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Reynelyn

texts.en:
Reynelyn is married with three children. Reynelyn is 31 years old and lives in Magcamiguing, Calamba.

Reynelyn sells grocery items and soft drinks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 3500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase three boxes of grocery items and five cases of soft drinks.

Reynelyn has been a member of PMPC for less than a year.

loans.use: To purchase three boxes of grocery items and five cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 49 years-old and lives in Pta. Sulong, Baliangao. She is married with two children. 

Marieta works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 29 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 in order to purchase more fish to sell. 

Marieta has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Chamroeurn

texts.en: Chamroeurn, 34 years-old, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been a sculptor for over ten years and is successful in his career. His wife is a homemaker. He wants to build a new house. Due to a lack of funds, Chamroeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 in order to purchase construction materials to build his house. In the future, he would like to expand his business and support his children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his house.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 33 years-old, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She shreds coconut meat and grinds rice into flour to sell in order to generate income for the family. Her husband is a Khmer traditional singer who sings at wedding ceremonies. Additionally, he is a motor taxi driver. In order to improve her family livelihood, Sina is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 in order to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. By doing so, she would have a new business and will generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her child to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with one child. Norma is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Norma is a farmer and grows assorted crops such as vegetables in order to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 in order to purchase fertilizers and pesticide. 

Norma has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer pesticides.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years-old and married with two children. 

To make a living, Edgar owns and operates a motor transport service. Edgar has been in his business for two years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Edgar joined Kiva partner GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgar is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better service.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Aida is married and has four children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a cafeteria business, cooking goods and selling them to the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

Aida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital and to purchase raw materials for her cafeteria. In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as an additional investment in her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and to finish supporting the studies of her children.

loans.use: to use as additional capital and purchase raw materials for the cafeteria.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a single parent. She has two children. Phoebe is 24 years old and resides at Capucao, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Phoebe owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Phoebe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Phoebe hopes to expand her business to provide for the basic needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco, aged 75, is a widower with four children, residing in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

He operates a raising crops venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP in this business.

Francisco has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2004, he joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Francisco wants to save to establish a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married. She is 53 years old, and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Emma owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP from this business.

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2011, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Jover

texts.en:
Jover is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jover owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Jover has been in his business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Jover joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jover is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. He will use these funds to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en: The Putri Mandiri group needs a new loan to increase their businesses. Each member will receive 1.5M IDR and will use it to purchase piglets. Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase four superior piglets. The superior piglets are very expensive now. One piglet is Rp.500,000, so for four piglets she will spend 2M IDR. The rest of the money for the piglets will come from her last profits. The group hopes that next time they can receive a higher loan of 2M IDR.

loans.use: To purchase four superior piglets

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married and has three children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of snack goods in the local community. Rosa has been in her business for four years and earns 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Rosa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is married with two children. She is 42 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. Rosario is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living which she has been doing for 26 years. Rosario has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional feed for raising livestock. She has been a member of PMPC for six years and, in the future, hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for raising livestock

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 36, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing rice for over four years and are successful in their career. 

Due to less income, Than is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a squeezing machine for squeezing sugar cane to get juice to sell. By doing so, she would have a new business and generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her new business, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

Note: Than's husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a squeezing machine for squeezing sugar cane to get juice to sell

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en: Seeing the succes of the Sambi Ternak, the group received a higher loan from MUK. Their prior loan was 10M IDR. Now the group received 14M IDR. Most members received 1.5M IDR and two of them received 1M IDR. Luh, as the head, was replaced by Ketut because she moved to another city in east Bali following her husband who works there. Ketut used her loan to purchase four local pigs for pigroll. She hopes the business will run smoothly like last period and she can earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase four local piglets

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is a widow with five children. She is 40 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Raquel owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she has been in this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP from this business. She has requested a loan of 8,241.24 PHP to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2007, Raquel became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Raquel wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, aged 37, is married and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over 10 years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She wants to build a new house. Since she doesn’t have enough funds, Sophal is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase construction materials for building her house. In the future, she would like to weave scarves to sell to generate more income for the family and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building her house

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en: Marlina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Marlina has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy bananas and coconuts to sell. Marlina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Tessie makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. Tessie has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like binake and tilaob to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like binake and tilaob to sell

loans.name: Chanthim

texts.en: Chanthim, 30, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over eight years, have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and breeding pigs. Additionally, they are distillers and run a rice mill as well. In order to improve business, Chanthim is requesting a loan of USD1000 to purchase more pigs to breed in order to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to breed to generate more income

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, 62, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over 20 years, have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice, and fattening up cattle to use in their farming selling them for a profitable price. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. 

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Sun is requesting a loan of USD1200 to run a new business by renting a store in the market so her children can sell electronic equipment. By doing so, her children would generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to rent a store in the market so her children can sell electronic equipment

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Lyn makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Lyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. Maria Fe makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks. Maria Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, aged 34, is married and lives with her husband and three school-aged children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running a pub, which sells all kinds of drink and food, for over six years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction foreman. In order to improve her family's economy, Sophea is requesting a loan of USD1200 to run a new business by purchasing groceries to sell to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell to generate more income

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, aged 54, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has been a construction worker for over 20 years and is successful in his career. His wife has been fattening up cattle to sell for over 20 years as well. Three of his children are employed; two are construction workers who construct ceilings and another one is a garment worker.

 In order to improve his family's economy, Thol is requesting a loan of USD800 to purchase more materials to use in his construction work. By doing so, he would be able to run his business smoothly and generate more income to support his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and support his youngest child to study at a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to use in his construction work

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en: Cresilda is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with three children. Cresilda makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks. Cresilda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elma makes and sells corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She's had this business for five years. She's requesting a loan for 7000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks.

Elma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 23 year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 1 to 3 years. She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

Previously, she was involved in tailoring services. For the last seven years, she has been involved in the poultry industry selling chickens. Her business is located at a busy market and her primary customers are regulars. 

In addition, Mary sells items made of plastic to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortages of chickens. She will use the 20000 KES loan to buy more chickens. Mary's business goal is to increase her customer base within five years.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for selling.

loans.name: Yura

texts.ru:
Юра  родился в 1983 году в городе Капане, а в 2003 он вместе с семьей переехал в деревню Шишкерт Сьюникской области. После окончания средней школы, Юра окончил Капанский колледж и получил специальность строителя. Юра пока не женат, и живет вместе с родителями. 
Вся семья Юры занимается сельским хозяйством уже на протяжении 7 лет. На собственном земельном участке Юра выращивает яблоки на продажу. Так как его собственный участок небольшой, он также арендует землю, на которой выращивает картофель для продажи, а оставшуюся часть земли использует как пастбище для своих домашних животных. Юра с помощью родителей разводит крупный рогатый скот, овец, пчел и кур. 
Картофель и яблоки Юра вместе с родителями продают на рынках Сьюникской области, а мясо, молоко, мед и шерсть у них покупают постоянные покупатели прямо из дома. 
Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством Юра и его родители содержат семью.
Юре необходим кредит на сумму 300.000 драм для покупки 5 овец, что позволит ему увеличить доход своей семьи в будущем.
texts.en:
Yura was born in 1983 in the town of Kapan, and in 2003 he and his family moved to the village of Shishkert in the Syunik province. After finishing high school, Yura went to the Kapan technical college and graduated with a diploma in construction. So far Yura is single and lives together with his parents.
Yura’s whole family has been doing farm work for seven years. On his own land plot, Yura grows apples for sale. Since his own  plot is small, he also leases [additional] land for growing potatoes for sale, using the rest  as grazing land for his livestock. Yura and his parents raise cattle, sheep, bees and chickens.

Yura and his parents sell potatoes and apples at markets in the Syunik province. Meat, milk, honey and wool are sold directly out of their home to  loyal customers. Thanks to   farm work, Yura and his family are able to provide for the household needs.
Yura needs a loan of 300,000 ADM in order to buy five sheep, which will allow him to increase his family’s income in the future.

loans.use: To buy 5 more sheep for his farm

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Rene has a shop where she sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 10 years. She's requesting a loan of 8000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Rene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Riza has a shop that sells coconuts, jack-fruit & bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy coconuts, jack-fruit & bananas to sell.

Riza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Riza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, jack-fruit & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Doriza

texts.en:
This is Doriza, 32, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Gideon, a musician, and she is mother to her two children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Doriza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Doriza hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with six children, five of whom are enrolled in school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Emmanuel has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past four years; his potential clients are his neighbours and the local area community members. He dreams of improving his living standard. 

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase stocks of dry fish and fuel for his new retail business. He decided to join Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of dry fish and fuel for his new retail business.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Merilyn has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes & "suman" (a variety of rice cakes). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 Php to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Merilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Merilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Emee has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Php to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emee has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Erdenedalai

texts.en:
Erdenedalai, 31, sells clothes in the outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her family in the slum district. She sells track suits and other kinds of outfits.  She has been running her business for 6 years.  She had started her business with just one stall and now she owns 2 stalls in the bazaar. Her husband works as a driver of a heavy truck on a mine site. 
Erdenedalai wants to increase her business working capital to expand sales volume and to further increase her earnings. Also after a month there will be Lunar Year which is a traditional Mongolian celebration. Demand on clothes will increase notably during those days. The loan Erdenedalai is taking will be dedicated to purchase clothes in a large amounts to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in large amounts to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Burenbuyan

texts.en: Burenbuyan, 34 is an accountant with a private company and has been working for 5 years. She lives with her husband and her daughter in a slum suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Gurvanbaatar, has run a taxi service for the last several years. Lately his taxi has broken down and is in need of repair. Therefore he decided to renovate his car with the new spare-parts. The loan Burenbuyan is taking will be dedicated to purchase the new spare-parts for her husband’s taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new spare-parts for her husband’s taxi repairs.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Jessica has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for 6,000 PhP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ninguma

texts.en:
Ninguma is a married woman with one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provisions of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
 
Ninguma has operated a clothes selling business for the past six years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase more stock of clothes and a sewing machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Lilian is making and peddling corn snacks like binake & tilaob. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks.

Lilian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lilian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make corn snacks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children. Three of the children attend school and four have completed their studies. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
 
Fatuma has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past four years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of the rising cost of fuel. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 35-year-old married man with two children aged 6 and 11. He distributes water to earn a living; he's been in the business for two years and has employed four people. He earns extra income from his employment. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 90000 KES to buy a water tank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is applying for another loan to start a new printing business. She will use this 40000 KES loan to purchase a printing and photocopy machine for her new business. In the future, Moreen aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Moreen has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a printing and photocopy machine for her new business.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is a 46-year-old mother of three sons and lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia on their own small plot of land in an outer ger (nomadic tent) district without basic infrastructure. Her husband runs a taxi business while their older two sons attend a local university and high school. 

Sarantuya supports her family by operating several kinds of businesses. Currently, she operates a clothing retail business at the largest indoor market of the city. She doesn't own her stall yet, so she rents it from others. Her goal is to increase her working capital in order to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season and to own her current stall. Thus, she is requesting a 1.500.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan.

loans.use: to prchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sururu

texts.en:
Sururu is a 32-year-old married man with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still young for school. His wife is a business lady who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his child. 

Sururu has operated a butchery shop business for the past four years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business into a well furnished butchery in the future.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase two meat cows for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase two meat cows for resale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 29 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Baliangao. She is married and has three children.
 
To earn a living, Ofelia has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 4,200 each month doing this work. 

Ofelia has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase five sacks of flour and other ingredients for her snack vending business.

Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of flour and other ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks, bread, milk, etc., to add to her stock.

loans.name: Edivina

texts.en:
Edivina is 41 years old and lives in Bigaan, Baliangao. She is married and has four children.
 
Edivina works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 13 years. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase materials for fish pen.
 
Edivina has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase materials for fish pen.

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en:
Ma.Teresa is 25 years old and lives in Manamong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children.
 
Ma.Teresa has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.
 
Ma.Teresa has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 42-year-old married man with 10 children who attend school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Mohamed has operated as a carpenter for the past 10 years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase timber and logs for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and logs for his business.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is married and has two children. Roel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Roel is a farmer who grows pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. 

He has requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase housing materials such as plywood, nails, etc. 
 
Roel has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials such as plywood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is 59 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Lelia has a coconut-buying business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  of 14,900 PHP to purchase more coconuts for her coconut-buying business. 

Lelia has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her coconut-buying business.

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married woman with seven children, five of whom attend school while two have completed school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mauwa has operated a food stall for the past six years; her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 45,000 she wants to purchase more stock of cooking oil, sugar, rice and beans for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cooking oil, sugar, rice and beans for her food stall.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 50 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Eliza has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Eliza has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Eliza hopes to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is 32 years old and married to Bernard, who is a plumber. They have five children. She is a poultry farmer, a business she has been in for five years, and gets a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD and she has requested a loan worth Kshs 30,000 which she will be use to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

The profit anticipated will help her complete the rental houses that she is constructing. Her dream is to educate her children well.

loans.use: To buy chicks to rear for sale.

loans.name: Jorgie

texts.en:
Jorgie is 30 years old and lives in Calaran, Calamba. She is married with 2 children.

Jorgie has a grocery store business and earns approximately 4,600 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to construct her own house. 

Jorgie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of cement, 40 pieces of galvanized iron sheets, etc. to construct her own house

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a very hardworking woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. She is 34 years old and married to Paul, who is also a farmer, and they have two children. 

She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs like seeds and chemicals. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 56 years old and living in her own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. For ten years, she has been running a retail shop and this has facilitated her in paying school fees for her children.

Her personal goal is to educate her children and she wishes to expand her business to new markets in the future. Margret needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old and lives in  Oroquieta City. She is married with five  children. 

Emma has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. 

Emma has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Caritas

texts.en: Caritas is 26 years old. She is married with two children, 6 and 5 months old. The older child attends school. She owns an internet cyber café which she has been running for two years. With the requested loan she will buy more electronics items for use in the cyber café. She will use the profits to put aside savings. In the future, she will expand her internet business.

loans.use: To buy more electronics items for use in the internet cafe.

loans.name: Nyangasi

texts.en:
Nyangasi is a married man with six school-going children. He owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Nyangasi has operated a tailoring business for the past six years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase fabrics, embroidery and also pay for sewing machine repair. He decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, embroidery, and also pay for sewing machine repair.

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарджон женат и ответственный отец двух несовершеннолетних детей. Более 4-х лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных и бахчевых культур. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за детьми. Кроме этого Зафарджон занимается откормом скота, и на сегодняшней день он имеет трех голов крупного рогатого скота.  Этот бизнес приносит ему хороший доход. С этой целью Зафарджон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zafarjon is married and is a responsible father of two adolescent children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural and melon crops for over four years.  His wife is involved in household work and looks after the children.  Besides this, Zafarjon is involved in fattening up livestock, and today has three heads of cattle.  This business yields a good income.  Zafarjon is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and to buy small livestock.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and small livestock

loans.name: Jembie

texts.en:
Jembie is 34 years old and lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with three children. 

Jembie has a grocery store business and earns approximately PHP 5,200 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP  to purchase equipment for repairs on the location of her Videoke business.

Jembie has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for repairs on the location of her Videoke business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 29 years old and a single mother of one child living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a produce business and she has been operating it for three years now. Anna has a challenge of her customers not paying her on time and this affects her business cash flow. 

Her personal goal is to educate her only child and also expand her business to new markets. Ann needs the credit facility to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is aged 47. She has six children, all of whom go to school. Her husband works as a teacher. She sells beer and has spent 18 years in the same business. She is very determined to use the loan to improve and increase her inventory of selling beer. Catherine plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children. She would like to own her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for resale.

loans.name: Rajabu

texts.en:
Rajabu is a married man with two children who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Rajabu has worked as a driver for the past three years; his potential clients are local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of starting a new vegetable grocery business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions and cabbages for his new grocery business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions and cabbages for his new greengrocery business.

loans.name: Nduni

texts.en: Nduni is 40 years old and married with six children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as good because she is visited regularly by her customers. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Nduni has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business further in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and a single mother of three children living in Hioma, Uganda. She has a poultry project which she has operated for ten years. Her major hardship is the high cost of feed and her personal goal is educating her children while her business goal is to own at least 1000 birds in  the next two years.

Sarah wants a loan to pay school fees for her children as the term is fast approaching.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 30 years old. He has three children who are aged between 1 and 6 years. He owns a shop which he has been running for the past few years. Jean Damascene wants the loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar, salt, rice and many home use products. He plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: To purchase more goods that he will sell in his general store.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is a 47-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a dancing trainer.

Chi earns an income to support her family by selling electrical products. She has been running her business for the past five years.

Chi would like to receive a loan to purchase more electrical products such as water heaters, electrical wires and other equipment to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and to set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical products such as water heaters, electrical wires and other materials to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Lilia has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. 

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lydia Group

texts.en:
Lydia is married with two children. Lydia is 55 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga.

To earn a living, Lydia has a grocery store business. She has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4600. She has requested a loan of 14,950 PHP to purchase 10 boxes of grocery items and 12 cases of soft drinks. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

Lydia is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of grocery items and 12 cases of soft drinks.

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ramzo

texts.ru: Рамзо добрая и трудолюбия женщина. Она вдова и имеет троих детей. Более 20 лет она занимается скотоводством. Она также работает на молочной ферме. Сын тоже работает на ферме. Имеет 10 голов крупного рогатого скота. В бизнесе помогают дети. Рамзо хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свои жилищные условия. С этой целью она запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота. Рамзо надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Ramzo is a kind and hardworking woman.  She is a widow and has three children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years.  Ramzo also works at a milk farm.  Her son also works there.  She owns 10 heads of cattle.  Her children help her with the business.  Ramzo wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.  To achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan to purchase cattle.  Ramzo relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Georgine

texts.en: Georgine has one child who is three years old. She is 29 years old and married to a businessman. She has spent three years in the business of selling different items in a boutique. With the loan, she plans to invest in the boutique by adding more items for sale such as rice, sugar, soaps, and lotions. She will use the profits to build a house. She anticipates that in the future, she will become a very strong businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, soaps, and lotion to resell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Loan earns a living running a general store, which she has done for three years. 

Loan would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries to stock her general store

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung, 51, is the father of one son. Together with his wife, Hung lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn income from selling rice. He began this business five years ago.

He would like a loan to buy a greater quantity of rice so that he can attract more customers and increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that, through the loan, he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of rice so that he can attract more customers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old, comes from Gilgil, and is married to Joseph. They have two children aged 20 years and 13 years old.

Emily has a retail shop and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy new stock such as detergents, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. to add to her business for sale. 


She is optimistic that the loan will help her boost her business. She hopes to open a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: To buy detergents, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. to add to her stock.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 65 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with  four children. 

Apolonia has a pig-raising business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig-raising business. 

Apolonia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Apolonia hopes to own an agrivet supply business to earn money. Apolonia is proud of being a member of PMPC because they can answer her problems in terms of money.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase two sacks of rice, a bundle of wheat flour, a sack of beans and also renovate her café. In the future, Mwanamisi aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanamisi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice, a bundle of wheat flour, a sack of beans and also renovate her café.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en: Philippe is aged 36. He has three children aged between 3 and 7, and all of them attend schools. He has been supplying fruits at schools for the last six years. He has requested the loan to buy more fruits to supply the schools because the demand is high. He will save the profits, simply because he wants to become a more competent supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for supplying schools.

loans.name: Argentine

texts.en: Argentine is 35 years old. She has spent 11 years running a boutique from which she sells different items. Argentine wants the loan to buy more items to add in the boutique such as rice, sugar, soaps and cooking oil to sell. She plans to use the profits for buying a house. She dreams to have a very prosperous business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is 39 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children.

Alyn has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Alyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Alyn hopes to earn money for her family's daily needs. She is (MIGS) Member In Good Standing of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and maize seeds.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 53 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has six children.

To earn a living, Clarita has a piggery. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Clarita has requested a loan of PHP 22,000 to purchase feed for the pigs and to buy piglets to raise and then sell.

Clarita has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Clarita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the pigs and to buy piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn is married and has six children. She is 42 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jerelyn sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan PHP 2,500 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Jerelyn has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Mahmadhakim

texts.ru: Махмадхаким занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. В основном Махмадхаким выращивает лук, пшеницу, картофель и кукурузу. Он имеет пятилетний опыт работы и знает все нормативы посева. Данный момент Махмадхаким запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, ГСМ и семян для предстоящего посева. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mahmadhakim is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He is married and is a responsible father of four children.  Mahmadhakim primarily grows onions, wheat, potatoes and corn.  He has five years of work experience and knows all of sowing standards.  Currently, Mahmadhakim is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds for the upcoming sowing.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 29 years old and married to a cobbler. She has four children, between the ages of 3 and 9, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Valentine sells shoes and she has been running this business for the past nine years. With this loan she plans to purchase more shoes to resell. With the profits she plans to pay the school fees for her children. In the future, Valentine wants to be the sole supplier of shoes in the local markets nearby.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen, 54, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Nguyen and her husband support their family by running a general store in front of their house. Nguyen started this business sixteen years ago. 

From the store Nguyen sells biscuits, sugar, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular confectionery and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular confectionery and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with 6 children. Delia is 55 years old and lives in Ubay,Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Delia sells food snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Delia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Delia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 35 years old, and supports her two children ages twelve and six years. She has been in the salon business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 20, 000. 

Caroline has requested for a loan worth KES 30,000 to allow her to add more salon equipment like blow dryers, and a hair dryer to improve her services to her customers. 

The anticipated profit would help her future. Caroline's dream is to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment like a hair dryer,and blow dryers

loans.name: Sreyriya

texts.en: Sreyriya, 27, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and selling frogs for two years. Her husband is a basket weaver. In order to increase her family income, Sreyriya is requesting for a loan of USD 500 to purchase cattle to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to run a food store and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed to sell for a profitable price

loans.name: Tungalagtuya

texts.en:
Tungalagtuya is 30 year old widowed woman who lives with her 3 daughters in the central part of the country. After the death of her husband, she and her 3 daughters were left without a family provider. She moved to the center of the country to find work a year ago. She has been sewing and making traditional clothes in a rented room. Due to the coming traditional festival, she needs to purchase materials like silk and cotton for her work to sell them before the holiday. 

Tungalagtuya is an intelligent and a hardworking woman and says that 'I would like to receive this loan to earn more during the holidays and it's for our lives, my 3 daughters school fees and their clothes and other needs.' She is requesting 600,000 MNT to purchase material to sew Deel,  traditional Mongolian clothing.

loans.use: To purchase material to sew Deel, traditional Mongolian clothing.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 61, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 10 years and are successful in their career. In order to improve her business, Sina is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase agricultural machinery to use in her business. In the future, she would like to run a rubber plantation and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery to use in her business

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 31-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be patient and flexible. She operates a retail stall where she sells herbal medicines. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a viable place and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortages of herbal medicines. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy three bags of herbal medicines. Her business goal is to run a herbal hospital within five years.

loans.use: To buy three cartons of herbal medicines.

loans.name: Yot

texts.en: Yot, 50, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over 20 years and is successful in her career. Two of her children are employed. One is a garment worker and another one is a soldier. Yot is requesting a loan of USD 800 to pay for her child’s wedding ceremony. In the future, she would like to purchase piglets to breed nd then sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. Moreover, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with three children between 2 and 9 years old. Two of the children are in school and all live at home. Marie has been selling rice, peppers, and bitter ball for the past 17 years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peppers, and bitter ball for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, and bitter ball to sell

loans.name: Avdoldo

texts.en: Avdoldo is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province in northern Mongolia. She is an entrepreneur who does construction decoration with her husband. Since it is seasonal work, she cannot earn money in winter time, which lasts about five months. So she would like to run a garment retailing business so that she will have a regular job and earn for the family's needs. But she needs financial support to buy the supplies. She has made some research towards the business and found a perfect shop counter for it. She's an intelligent women who says, "I would like to live happily with my family earning in 4 seasons". The total amount she's requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy the clothes and start her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 36 years old. He is married and has two children between 8 and 11 years old.  Both of them go to school. Jean sells clothes of different styles and has been doing this for the last 13 years. He has requested the loan to buy more clothes to sell. He plans to use the profits for buying a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kageni

texts.en: Kageni is servicing her fourth loan after paying back the previous loans well and in good time. Her farming business is doing great. She plans to use this loan to buy more farm supplies, such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and hire manpower to aid in the farm. She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more  farming supplies.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en: Sarorn, 57, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish paste for over six years and is successful in her career. Her oldest daughter is a secondhand clothes vendor. Sarorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase wood for building her house. By doing so, she will have a comfortable house to live in. In the future, she would like to purchase a truck to carry fish paste, as well as clothes to sell. Moreover, she plans to support her children in their studies until they receive a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase wood for building her house.

loans.name: Nhork

texts.en:
Nhork, 45, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker. His wife runs a grocery store at home. Two of his children are employed in Thailand. 

In order to improve his family’s economy, Nhork is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill to generate more income for the family. In the future, he would like to expand his wife’s business and send his youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang, 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over twenty years and are successful in their careers. One of her children is employed in Thailand. 

Sang is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase wood for building her house. By doing so, she would have a comfortable house in which to live. In the future, she would like to support her children to study at a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase wood for building her house.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a married woman. She has two children who depend on her. She has been farming for a period of five years.

She knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She is a good client and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and to hire manpower to aid on the farm. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a 27 year old married woman. She describes herself as determined and flexible. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services, such as plaiting, blowdrying, etc., and sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to  buy more beauty products and also shoes and clothes for her boutique. Her business goal is to run a bigger boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, as well as shoes and clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 34, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. 

Since the motorbike is old and broken down very often, Mary is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a taxi and to commute to work. 

In the future, she would like to run a beauty salon at home to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study at a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a taxi and to commute to work.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a forty-year-old lady. She is single and the mother of four children. She distributes bread in Makueni. She has been in the business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Jedidah’s third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of bread for resale. She wants to use the profit to educate her children. 

In the future, she wants to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more bread for resale.

loans.name: Jackerline

texts.en:
Jackerline is 33 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 20 years old.  All of them are in school and live at home.  Jackerline has been selling used shoes for the past four years.  

She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friend.  Her favorite part about her business is that of buying.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for her business.  In future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoe for her business.

loans.name: Ayurzana

texts.en:
Ayurzana is 59 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia.  His wife helps with his business.  He started his meat and dairy products retailing business in 2003.  He travels across countryside to buy fresh and organic supplies from herders and he sells it to his customers at the market. 

He is a trusted supplier to many.  Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, the demand for his products will increase, and therefore, he needs to meet his demand.  He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "Even though I'm old I never want to burden anyone and I have a very bright future that one day I could build my own meat warehouse".  He is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat.

loans.name: Srey Toch

texts.en:
Srey Toch, age 29, is married and resides with her husband and one school-age child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been a garment worker since 2006.  Her husband is a construction foreman. 

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Srey Toch is requesting for a loan of USD 750 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.  By doing so, she can go to work on time and save some money from her transportation expense to support her family.  In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her child to get a good education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат 42 года года рождения, замужем имеет  детей. Она работает в течении 32 лет в детском саду воспитателем ей нравиться работать  с детьми.  Ей понадобились деньги  на лечение  мужа, который находиться  на пенсии. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2010 года, и довольна кредитованием.
texts.en:
Saodat was born in 1942. She is married and has children. Saodat has worked as a kindergarten teacher for 32 years; she enjoys working with children. She needs money for a medical treatment for her husband who is retired.
