Saodat has been with MDO Arvand, LLC since 2010 and is happy with the loan services.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her husband

loans.name: Etta

texts.en:
Etta is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is married with three children between the ages of 7 to 27 years old, three of them are in school and all live at home.  Etta has been selling dried fish for the past twenty-six years.  

She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from friends. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profits.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried cassava fish for her business.  In future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more dried cassava fish for her business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 32 years old.  He is married and a father of two children.  He has been farming on his piece of land for the past fifteen years.

He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer and to buy more animals.  He has been a good client.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru: Ислом молодой человек 24 лет, женат пока не имеет детей. Он проживает в сельской местности Бобочон Гафуровского района, поэтому основным доходом у него является прибыль с продажи скота. На полученный кредит он хочет купить корм для скота и отремонтировать хлев где он держит скот. Сейчас у него несколько голов мелко рогатого скота. Он благодаря кредитам смог увеличить поголовье баранов и улучшить социальное положение семьи.
texts.en: Islom is a young 24 year-old man, married and does not yet have children.  He lives in a rural area of the Bobjon Gafurov district, and this is why his main income is the profit from sales of livestock.  He wants to use this loan to purchase fodder for livestock and to repair a shed, where he keeps livestock.  Currently, Islom has several heads of small livestock.  Thanks to the lenders, he was able to increase his sheep headcount and improve his family's social status.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single mother of one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and house rent. 

Rehema has operated a vegetable grocery for the past six months. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low harvests in the dry seasons. She dreams of becoming a vegetable supplier.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of cabbage, potatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it has fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cabbage, potatoes,and onions for resale.

loans.name: Msaada

texts.en:
Msaada is a married woman with 3 children who are enrolled in school.  Her husband is a policeman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs.  She owns a house with electricity but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Msaada has operated a food stall for the past 3 years; in addition she also runs a leso (kanga) selling business.  Her potential clients are the local area women.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  She dreams of expanding her business

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and lesos for her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and lesos for her businesses.

loans.name: Khonbi

texts.ru: Хонби замужем и имеет двух детей. Она трудолюбивая и  добрая женщина. Она начала свой бизнес с большим трудом. Раньше у неё не была скота и средств для нормального содержания семьи, она вынуждена была уехать в Россию на заработки, а потом через год вернулась с хорошими заработанными деньгами. Затем она решила заниматься скотоводством и закупила скот на эти деньги. Вот уже более 6 лет она занимается этим бизнесом. Данный момент она нуждается в покупке корма для скота с целью расширения бизнеса и улучшения  домашних условий.
texts.en: Khonbi is married and has two children.  She is a hardworking and kind woman.  She started her business with great difficulties.  Previously, Khonbi did not have livestock and had no means to support her family well.  She had to go to Russia for work and then returned a year later with good earnings.  Khonbi then decided to get involved in animal husbandry and purchased livestock with her earnings.  She has now been involved in this business for over six years.  Currently, she needs to purchase fodder for livestock in order to expand her business and improve her household conditions.

loans.use: to buy fodder for cattle

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you Aminata, a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of 5,000,000.00 SLL in order to invest in her business. 

Aminata sells pans/dishes, coolers, glass cups, glass plates, spoons, etc.  She has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now.  A wife and a mother of three children who attend primary and secondary schools, the thirty-two-year-old was born in Sanda, near Makeni city, but now lives and sells in Makeni. 

Aminata has requested this loan in order to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy pans/dishes, coolers, glass cups, glass plates, spoons in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Hasanatu

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you Hasanatu, a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of 4,000,000.00 SLL in order to invest in her business. 

Hasanatu sells food stuffs like rice, palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc.  Hasanatu has been doing business for fifteen years now in the northern city of Makeni.  A widow and a mother of one secondary school child, the thirty-four year-old was born Makeni city.  Hasanatu has requested this loan in order to buy rice, vegetable oil, eggs, beans, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetable oil, eggs, beans, etc. to add to her business

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим  жизнерадостный мужчина. который занимается куплей и продажей фруктов. Он женат и имеет двоих детей, жена домохозяйка. Абдулкосим с помощью кредитов смог увеличить свой товарооборот. На получаемую прибыль от своей торговли он  смог отремонтировать свою комнату и купить новый телевизор. А теперь на запрашиваемую сумму хочет привезти партию бананов и мандаринов оптом. Абдулкосим выражает благодарность организации и инвесторам за финансирование.
texts.en: Abdulkosim is a cheerful man, who is involved in buying and selling fruits.  He is married and has two children, and his wife is a homemaker.  Abdulkosim was able to increase his product turnover, with the help of creditors.  He was also able to use the profits to repair his room and buy a new television.  And now he wants to use this loan to bring in an inventory of bananas and tangerines.  Abdulkosim expresses gratitude to the organization and investors for the financing.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and tangerines

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel has two children aged between one and three. Neither of his children go to school. Emmanuel works as a cobbler. He has requested a loan to buy a machine to help him in the business of making shoes. He plans to use the profits from the business expand his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rugiatu, a small scale businesswoman in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone.  Rugiatu sells medicines and packet water.  She has been a businesswoman for eight years now. 

The thirty-nine year old has requested for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL.  With the help of this loan, she will buy more drugs/medicines to add to her pharmacy. Born in Makeni city, Rugiatu is divorced, with two children who are attending primary schools.

loans.use: To buy more drugs/medicines to add to her pharmacy.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Абдукарим целеустремленный, добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Абдукарим работает в дехканском хозяйстве уже 4 года. С детства он работал с отцом на огороде и выращивал сельхозпродукции. В бизнесе помогает отец и супруга. Абдукарим хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, чтобы построить жилищный дом. С этой целью запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян репчатого лука.
texts.en: Abdukarim is a goal-oriented, kind and hardworking man.  He is married and is a loving father of two children.  Abdukarim has been working at a dekhan farm for four years.  Since childhood, he worked with his father in the garden and grew agricultural crops.  His father and wife help him with the business.  Abdukarim wants to expand his business and make a good profit in order to build a residential house.  To achieve this goal, he is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and onion seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and onion seeds

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано женщина 51 года, мужа нет в живых, имеет двоих детей. И сын и дочь семейные, Рано имеет троих внуков. Её сын работает шашлычником у входа в больницу, имеет хорошую продажу, т.к. хороший поток пациентов. У сына Рано есть маленькое кафе, которое необходимо отремонтировать,и обновить столовые приборы и столы. Для чего она и хочет получить следующий очередной кредит.
texts.en: Rano is a 51 year-old woman, her husband passed away, and she has two children.  Both her son and daughter have their own families.  Rano has three grandchildren.  Her son works as a shish kebab cook at a hospital entrance and has good sales because there are many patients.  Rano's son has a small cafe, which needs to be repaired, and cutlery and tables need to be updated.  This is why she wants to obtain her next loan.

loans.use: to purchase cutlery and tables

loans.name: Polland

texts.en:
Polland is a 48-year-old married man. He has four children, ranging in age from 12 to 25 years old. He describes himself as tolerant. 

Polland operates a bicycle business, with which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the varying fares charged to customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase two bicycles. His business goal is to own a van to provide transportation within five years.

loans.use: To buy two bicycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Муким повар со стажем. Его деятельность - изготовление и продажа национального таджикского блюда "манты".  Манты - это мучное блюдо, которое очень любит наш народ. Муким изготавливает манты из качественного говяжьего мяса и муки высшего сорта, поэтому у него знаменитые манты в Худжанде, которые пользуются большим спросом. В основном у него покупают на заказ на проведение мероприятий. Но кроме этой продукции Муким хочет начать выпекать мясные пирожки "самсы". Поэтому он на полученый кредит собирается купить электро духовку.
texts.en: Mukim is an experienced cook.  His business is preparing and selling a national Tajik dish "manty."  Manty is a dish made from flour, which is loved by our people.  Mukim cooks manty from a quality beef and highest-grade flour, and this is why his manty are famous in Khujand and are in high demand.  He primarily gets catering orders for events.  But besides these products, Mukim wants to begin baking meat pies "samosas."  This is why he plans to use this loan to buy an electric oven.

loans.use: to purchase an electric oven

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 37-year-old woman from Aqaba, Jordan.

Mayson is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase new furniture for her house with an aspiration of doing new decorations for the house and building a second floor.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.ru: Набичон мастер своего дела со стажем. Уже много лет он занимается производством и продажей деревянных окон и дверей. Из-за хорошего качества продукции он имеет много клиентов, которые закупаю у него товар и перепродают на рынке.Т.к сейчас зима и нет сухой древесины Набичон на получаемый кредит хочет купить четыре куба сухих брёвен у постоянного поставщика, для увеличения работы. Как он говорит благодаря получаемой прибыли он смог улучшить семейное положение семьи и расширить свою деятельность. При первом кредите у него был всего один работник, а на сегодняшний день у него два мастера помощника и один ученик, что говорит об расширении его производства.
texts.en: Nabichon is an expert at his craft, and has plenty of experience. He has been producing and selling wood-framed windows and wooden doors for many years. Because he does such high-quality work, he has lots of customers who purchase his products and resell them on the market. Since it is wintertime now, and there is no dry timber, Nabichon wants a loan to purchase four cubic meters of lumber from an established supplier so he can do more work. He says that thanks to the profits he has made, he has been able to improve his family's quality of life and expand his business. At the time he received his first loan, he had only one employee. But now he has two highly-skilled assistants and one apprentice, which is a good indicator of how much his production has expanded.

loans.use: For the purchase of wood to expand production.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself as a go-getter. 

Sera operates a retail store where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area. She says her biggest business challenge is the high cost of products sold. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more beauty products. Sera's business goal is to run a bigger retail store within five years.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her store.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Авз проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У них четверо детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он бухгалтер. В этой области работает пять лет. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа семян пшеницы.
texts.en: Avaz lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 33 years old. He is married and has four children. He has specialized secondary education. He is an accountant by profession and has worked in this field for five years. Avaz also grows and cultivates crops. He has been in this business for four years. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds of wheat.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town. She has an eleventh-grade education. She is married; her husband works with Liberia National Election. They have four children between 10 and 24 years old; all of them are in school and live at home. Mamie has been selling palm oil and plantains for the past 20 years. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насибе 47 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей. Два сына живут со своей семьёй отдельно, дочь также замужем живёт с мужем отдельно, поэтому на иждивении Насибы с мужем одна дочь 18-ти лет. Муж уже два года как уехал на заработки в Алма-ату, и каждый месяц присылает деньги на расходы семьи. Сама Насиба несмотря на доход с Алма-аты от мужа, занимается откормом и получением домашнего молока, а также и продажи его в своём посёлке. Она решила на получаемый кредит купить большую дойную  корову, для увеличения дохода с продажи её молока, чтобы улучшить свое семейное положение. Она благодарна всем инвесторам за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Nasiba is 47 years old, married, and has four children.  She has two sons who now have their own homes and families, a daughter who has also left home to live with her husband, so the couple's only dependent child is an 18-year-old daughter.  Nasiba's husband left two years ago to start working in Almaty.  Each month he sends in some money to help with family expenses.  Regardless of the income she receives from her husband in Almaty, Nasiba has been involved in cattle fattening and milk production at home.  She sells milk in her village.  She decided to request a loan in order to buy a large-size dairy cow, which will allow her to increase the income she gets from the sale of milk and to improve her family's living conditions.  She is thankful to all lenders for their understanding and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 36-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 16 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be self-motivated. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services such as blow-drying and plaiting, and sells hair oil. She has been in this business for three years. Her business is located near a busy bus station. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase one blow dryer and hair chemicals. Within the next five years, Ann's business goal is to own three other beauty salons.

loans.use: To buy one blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Meluan

texts.en:
Meluan has applied for his third loan. He has planned to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals, and to also buy animals for fattening. He has a good history with KADET LTD. His farming business is doing very well, and he is happy.

He intends to use the returns from the loan to plow back into farming and, in part, to repay the loan. His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education.

He is hardworking man who aims to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals, and to also buy animals for fattening.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en: Virginie is 43 years old. She has 4 children between 5 and 17 years old. They all go to school. She has spent 4 years selling different items in the shop. With the loan she will add other items such as rice, cooking oil and peanuts. She plans to use the profits from the business to reinvest in the business. In the future, she would like to increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as rice, cooking oil and peanuts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a single woman. She has 3 children ranging in age from 14 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be honest and obedient.  Previously, she was employed at a salon. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services such as blow drying and plaiting, and she sells hair oil. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of hair oil. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase hair oil and cosmetics. Nancy's business goal is to run several similar outlets within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимиру нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы купить пленку для теплицы к новому сезону, а также закупить семена и удобрения. В прошлом году также брал кредит на пленку и удобрения. Благодаря кредиту смог получить хорошу дополнительную прибыль.

В этом году Владими сделал ремонт в доме, провели воду в дом, сделали туалет и ванну в доме (до этого туалет был на улице). Зимой (в несезон) Владимир находит дополнительную работу разнорабочим, чтобы увеличить доход для свой семьи. Проживает с женой и маленькой дочкой.
texts.en: Vladimir needs extra funding to buy a film for his greenhouse for the new season, and also to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  Last year he already received a loan to purchase some film and fertilizer.  Thanks to that loan he was able to generate good extra income.  In the past year, Vladimir has been working on his home, bringing water into the house and building a toilet and bathroom (previously the toilet was outside of the house).  In winter (low season), Vladimir finds extra work doing odd jobs, to increase the income he brings home to his family.  He lives with his wife and young daughter.

loans.use: to buy film for his greenhouse, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou a  25 ans et est père d’un enfant.  Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Bougouni, dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités génératrices de revenus à Bamako notamment les travaux journaliers auprès des commerçants, mais sans succès, il décida de retourner en famille à Bougouni pour apprendre le métier de tailleur auprès de son oncle.
Avec 5 années d’expérience, il maîtrise cette activité et commence à évoluer seul.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités il décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso, pour acheter  une machine de broderie et des matériels de merceries à Bamako. Il est sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.  
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille
Avec ce bénéfice il ambitionne améliorer son atelier.
texts.en:
Mamadou is 25 years old and the father of one child. He, his wife and his child live together in a large, traditional family in the North Hérémakono district of Bougouni.

Having already tried out several revenue-generating activities - most notably work as a day labourer for shopkeepers - without success, Mamadou returned to his family in Bougouni so that he could learn tailoring from his uncle. He is now a skilled tailor with 5 years experience and is starting to work on his own.

In order to strengthen his business, Mamadou has decided to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso so that he can buy an embroidery machine and some haberdashery items in Bamako. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso.

Mamadou anticipates that this loan will enable him to make a monthly profit of 50 000 francs, which he will use to repay the loan and cover his household expenses. He would also like to use his profits to improve his studio.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Asha has operated a charcoal and firewood business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Aboudou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aboudou est un homme marié de 52 et père de 6 enfants qui réside avec sa femme et ses enfants à Zantièbougou, village situé à 30 kilomètre de Bougouni.
Il a fréquenté l’école coranique pendant des années puis il abandonne au profit des activités génératrices de revenus.
Il avait tenté plusieurs activités notamment la vente de chaussures et tissus, mais sans réussite. Alors il décida  de rapprocher son oncle pour apprendre la vente de céréales.
Avec une expérience de plus de 20 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Afin d’agrandir son entreprise, il décida de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à son quatrième prêt après avoir correctement remboursé les trois précédents. Il compte ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne de petit mil et 1 tonne de riz.
Il s’approvisionne à Zantièbougou et dans les villages  environnants.
La vente se fait a Zantièbougou mais aussi au grand marché de Bougouni et dans les différentes villages les jours de marché hebdomadaire.
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. Il envisage agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
Mr. Aboudou is a married man, 52 years of age, and the father of six, living with his wife and children in Zantièbougou, a village 30 km from Bougoni.

He used to go to a  Qur'anic school for some time, but later he dropped out in order to make a living.

He has tried several business activities, such as selling shoes and cloth, but without success. And so he decided to ask his uncle to train him in selling cereals. Now, with over 20 years of experience, he masters his work well. In order to expand his business, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and is now on his fourth loan, having properly repaid the prior three. He plans to use this new loan to buy one ton [about 2205 lbs] of corn, one ton of millet and one ton of rice.

He stocks up in Zantièbougou and nearby villages. He sells in Zantièbougou and also at the big market of Bougoni and at weekly markets in various villages. With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan and cover family expenses. He plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 39 year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be determined and hardworking. He operates a retail business where he provides cleaning services. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is mobile and his primary customers are households, offices and residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of cleaning detergents. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more cleaning detergents and a new cleaning machine. Alex's business goal is to run a big cleaning service company within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more cleaning detergents and a new cleaning machine.

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Soumaila est un homme marié de 35 ans et père de 1 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant  chez son père  à Bougouni dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après l’école coranique, Monsieur Soumaila décida de partir en aventure, précisément en Libye à la recherche d’une vie meilleure.
Ses ambitions n’ont pas été réalisées, il décida de retourner au pays précisément à Bougouni auprès de son oncle pour apprendre le commerce notamment la vente des articles divers.
Avec une expérience de 6 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Dans le but de renforcer son activité, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 20 pièces de tissus, 40 pantalons et 25 chemises.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et effectue ses ventes à une  clientèle  composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les périodes où les ventes de ses articles sont intenses.
Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Soumaila compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise..
 Dans les années à venir il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Soumaila is 35-year-old married man with one child. He, his wife and his child live in his father's house in the North Hérémakono district of Bougouni.

Having completed Koranic school, Soumaila decided to set out in search of adventure and a better life in Libya. Unable to fulfill his ambitions, he decided to return to Bougouni so that he could learn the business of sales, particularly how to sell various products, from his uncle. Soumaila is now a skilled salesman with 6 years experience.

In order to strengthen his business, he decided to rejoin Soro Yiriwaso so that he would be able to buy 20 pieces of fabric, 40 pairs of trousers and 25 shirts. He gets his supplies in Bamako and sells his merchandise to men and women. He does a lot of business during periods of religious celebrations and big ceremonies (like baptisms and weddings). This is his second loan request from Soro Yiriwaso.

Soumaila expects this loan to enable him to make a monthly profit of 75 000 francs, which he will use to improve his business. He plans to expand his shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline aged 27. She is married and has two children between five and eight years old. She owns a boutique which she has been running for the past 15 years. With the loan, she will buy more tomatoes and other items such as soft drinks and rice as well as other items for the boutique.  Aline would like to use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, soft drinks and and rice to resell.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un homme de 21 ans et sans enfants qui vit chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, dès son jeune âge il suivait les animaux c’est à dire l’activité de berger auprès de son père au village.
Quelles années plus tard il décida  de quitter le village pour Bougouni afin d’apprendre le commerce notamment l’achat vente des articles de boutique auprès de son frère.
 Avec 5 année d’expérience, il maîtrise cette activité. Après avoir correctement remboursé, son premier prêt , il est à son deuxième prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs du sucre, 5 cartons de thé, 5 cartons de cigarettes et 3 cartons de savons pour sa boutique.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, monsieur Yaya compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage toujours agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Yaya is a 21-year-old man. He has no children, and he lives with his father in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni. He did not attend school, but rather, from a very young age, helped his father look after animals (shepherding) in the village where they used to live.

Some years later, he decided to leave the village and move to Bougouni in order to learn about the business of sales, in particular buying and selling goods in a shop, from his brother. With five years of experience, he has an excellent command of this business. After having properly paid back his first loan, he is asking for a second loan in order to buy three bags of sugar, five boxes of tea, five boxes of cigarettes, and three boxes of soap for his shop. He buys his supplies in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His customers are typically locals.

With this loan, Yaya expects to achieve monthly profits of 35,000 FCFA. With the profits, he still plans to enlarge his shop.

loans.use: to buy various items for his shop

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en:
Lamia is a 62-year-old widow from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Lamia has a home-based project in which she trades in clothes in addition to doing embroidery. Lamia is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes for resale.

An aspiration of Lamia's is to have her own shop to better display her products and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen, a 26-year-old married mother of a three-year-old son, describes herself as optimistic. The operator of a beauty salon providing services such as hair blowdrying, plaiting, etc., she has been involved in this business for four years. Her salon is located in a busy area, and her customers are both repeat and new.

Karen's biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the salon, and she will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a blow dryer. In the next five years, Karen hopes and dreams of running several similar outlets.

loans.use: to buy a blow dryer.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine, 27, is the mother of a one-and-a-half-year-old child. Vestine has spent three years operating a restaurant, and with this loan she will add more foodstuffs including potatoes, sugar and rice for use in the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Né à Soumako cercle de Bougouni, Monsieur Karim est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 5 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Dougounina.
Très vite il abandonna l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités comme la vente de boutique sans succès en raison surtout de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement.
Il finit par la suite à apprendre le métier de soudeur auprès de son ami.
Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise cette activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 10 barres de fer pour la fabrication des portes et fenêtres et 1 cartons de baguette.
Il s’approvisionne Bougouni. 
Il est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Son atelier est situé au bord la route reliant Bougouni à Sikasso.
Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise.
texts.en:
Karim was born in Soumako, in the Bougouni Cercle. He is 38 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his wife and children in the Dougounina neighborhood of Bougouni.

He left school early on in order to pursue income-generating activities instead. He tried his hand at several things such as running a shop, but was never successful because of his lack of working capital. He finally ended up learning how to solder from a friend. With over ten years of experience, he has a thorough knowledge of this trade.

In order to obtain funds, he decided to become involved in the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. With the loan, he will buy ten iron bars for making doors and windows, and one box of soldering rods.

He gets his supplies in Bougouni. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. His workshop is located on the road which links Bougouni and Sikasso. His customers are typically people who live in the local area.

He expects to earn monthly profits of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy iron bars and soldering rods

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un homme marié de 26 ans et sans enfant.  Il vit avec sa femme  dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la réparation des motos pendant des années. 
Dans le souci de diversifier ses activités il décide d’ajouter à cette réparation de motos, l’achat vente de pièces détachées. Avec une expérience de 2 années, il maîtrise cette activité de vente de pièces détachées. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il décide de collaborer avec le  programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.
Après avoir correctement remboursé son premier prêt il est à son deuxième qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 pneus, 15 batteries, 3 trousseaux de clé,  30 chambres à air, 1 carton de piston, à Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes à une clientèle diverse et variées.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Yaya compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 61 500 FCFA. 
Il envisage avec ce bénéfice agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Yaya is 26 years old and married. He has no children. He lives with his wife in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni.

He did not attend modern school, but rather began pursuing income-generating activities from a very young age. For years, he worked repairing motorcycles. Wanting to diversify his business, he decided that in addition to repairing motorcycles, he would buy and sell spare parts as well. With two years of experience, he has a thorough knowledge of the business of selling spare parts.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing customer base, he decided to become involved in Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. After having properly paid back his first loan, he is now asking for a second loan which he will use to buy 20 tires, 15 batteries, 3 sets of keys, 30 inner tubes, and 1 box of pistons. He will buy all of these supplies in Bamako. He sells his products to a wide array of customers.

With this loan, Yaya expects to earn monthly profits of 61,500 FCFA. With the profits, he plans to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, the married mother of a one-year-old daughter, describes herself as an honest person who operates a grocery store selling vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business, located in a busy area, for 10 years.

Ann's biggest business challenge is the high cost of vegetables and fruits, and she will use this Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits. Ann's business goal is to run a well-stocked grocery store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas, the father of a one-year-old child, has been making wood furniture for the past four years. Cleophas has requested this loan to buy more quality woods for his business, and he will reinvest the profits back into his enterprise. He dreams of owning a woodworking shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more wood for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, a 56-year-old single mother of four children, has been running a grocery store to earn a living for the past nine years. Describing her business environment as competitive, she has been able to grow her business since joining Faulu Kenya, and hopes to expand in the future. Elizabeth is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Veni

texts.en:
Veni is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail stall where she sells school uniforms, especially sweaters. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent place to operate from. 

Veni will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more school uniforms to sell. Veni's hope and dream is to  run a well-stocked boutique within five years.

loans.use: To buy more school uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Для успешного ведения бизнеса Виктору нужно укрепить теплицы (слабоватый каркас), закупить пленку и семена для посева. Предыдущий кредит Виктор брал на постройку двух теплиц. За счет увеличения посадочной площали в прошлом сезоне доход Виктора вырос почти в два раза!

На заработанные деньги Виктор построил ище одну теплицу, а также поменял крышу в своем доме (раньше она протекала). Помимо этого Виктор приобрел большой прицеп для автомобиля, чтобы вывозить продукцию на продажу.

Виктор переехал в Водянное в 2009 году и начал заниматься фермерством с нуля. Вначале построии одну теплицу, потом еще две. Так понемногу развивался. Теперь имеет стабильный бизнес, который приносит ему постоянный доход.

Примечание: на фото Виктор вместе с своим сыном.
texts.en:
To ensure the successful management of Viktor's business, it is necessary to strengthen the greenhouses (rather weak frame) and to buy polyethylene film and seeds for sowing, 

Viktor took the previous loan to build two greenhouses. Due to the increase in planting area, Viktor's income grew to almost double last season! Viktor built another greenhouse for the money he earned, and further changed the roof of his house (earlier it leaked). In addition, Viktor purchased a large trailer for his car to take products out for sale. 

Viktor moved to Vodyanoye in 2009 and started farming from scratch. In the beginning he built one greenhouse, then another two, thus developing the business gradually. Now he owns a stable business, which brings him a permanent income. 

Note: In the photo, we see Viktor with his son.

loans.use: to repare his greenhouses and purchase seeds

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mejumaa has operated a business selling mats for the past 12 years. In addition, she sells lesos (kanga). Her potential clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of products due to inflation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase sisal fibers for weaving her mats and some pairs of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sisal fibers and lesos (kanga)

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a 31-year-old single man who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Kassim has operated as a mason for the past 10 years. In addition, he is a fisherman. His potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of customers delaying to pay their debts on time. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase construction materials like building blocks, cement, and spades for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like building blocks, cement, and spades

loans.name: Kezie

texts.en: Kezie is age 33. She is married to a carpenter. Kezie sells fish and she has been doing this business for the past 11 years. She has requested the loan to buy more fish to sell. With the profits, she will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 30-year-old, married woman. She is married to a businessman.

To earn a living, Jane owns and operates a restaurant, which she has been running for 15 years.

She is requesting this loan to add more foodstuffs for resale purposes and to purchase equipment for her restaurant. With the profits she expects as a result of the loan, she would like to construct a house because she is tired of renting. In the future, she would like to establish a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 32-year-old married lady, who has two daughters and one son.

Nisreen has a hobby of making hair styles and doing make-up for others, and following her hobby she launched her business, a beauty salon, a year ago and managed it very well.

Now Nisreen wants to open new sections beside the make-up and hair styling room for massage and a big gymnastic room, so she has applied for a loan to buy the required equipment like a treadmill and massage tools so she can proceed with her expansion.

loans.use: to buy massage tools so she can proceed with her expansion.ز

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is a 29-year-old, married woman. She is married to a businessman. She and her husband have two children who are 7 and 9 years old.

To earn a living, she has been running a salon for the past 11 years.

With the proceeds of the loan she is requesting, she would like to buy more supplies for her salon, including a kettle to heat water, shampoo, and other hair supplies. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she plans to pay her children's school fees. She dreams of having a very successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her salon (e.g., a kettle, shampoo, and other hair supplies)

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 25 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have both three children and all of them go to school. She sells spare parts in her shop and she has spent five years in this business. With the loan, she will buy more spare parts to sell. With the profits, she will pay the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 28-year-old single lady. Wafaa is the youngest of her four brothers and sisters.

Two years ago, she started a small business buying baby diapers in large quantity at a wholesale price, packing them in smaller quantities and selling them.
.
Now Wafaa has applied for a youth loan to increase the quantity she has of baby diapers so she can make more profit and open a small store as a retail business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of baby diapers.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 56-year-old housewife, who has four sons and daughters; three of them are college students.

Having three children in college at the same time has led their father to work two jobs so he can afford their university fees. For that reason, Amneh wanted to help her husband and has applied for this loan to pay for part of her children’s semester fees, so they can graduate as soon as possible and help the family when they find start working.

Because Amneh is a conservative person she asked one of her sons, Mohammad, to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To pay her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 41-year-old widow. She has four children between the ages of 3 and 19. All of them attend school. 

She sells tomatoes and has been running this business for fourteen years. She wants the loan to add more tomatoes for resale. She expects to use the profits for renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Amina has operated a shoe-selling business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase more pairs of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jonadamu

texts.en: Jonadamu, age 34, is married to a businesswoman. They have two children between one and seven. The oldest attends school. Professionally, Jonadamu is a carpenter, which he is very interested to specialize in even though he has been running a small boutique for the past years. With this new loan, he wants to buy table saws and expects to use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: to buy table saws.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 37 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 4 years old to 8 years old. He describes himself to be honest, courageous and focused. He operates a grocery stall where he sells fruits, cereals and vegetables such as water melons, bananas, tomatoes, onions, beans, maize, black beans, oranges, potatoes etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of vegetables, fruits and cereals to sell. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy five bags of beans. Charles' business goal is to have expanded his grocery stall and own several similar outlets within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy five bags of beans for sale

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 37 year-old married man with no children. His wife Saumu is a tailor who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Juma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past 1 year; his potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of lack of adequate capital to expand his business. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages and onions for resale.

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 53 years old. She has 6 children who are between the ages of of 13 and 30. Except the oldest others are enrolled in schools. Evaste sells potatoes and bananas for the period of three years. With the loan she will buy more potatoes and bananas for sale. She plans to use the profits for making her home clean as well as renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and bananas for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 33 year old married man. He has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 10. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail stall where he sells sugarcane. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a populated and viable area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of transportation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugarcane for sale. His business goal is to run a wholesale business of sugarcane within 5 years. His hope and dream is to be a big and successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane for sale

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with 5 children who have completed school. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Zainabu has operated a food stall for the past 15 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, wheat flour and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access fund to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of rice, wheat flour and cooking fat for her food stall.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 28-year-old single man who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Jamal has operated a phone accessories selling business for the past 1 year; his potential clients are local villagers. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase more phone accessories like batteries, phone covers and other spare parts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories like batteries, phone covers and other spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 26-year-old married man with 1 child who is enrolled in school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Juma has operated as a carpenter for the past 3 years; his potential clients are local villagers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of establishing a workshop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase timber, nails and sandpaper for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber, nails and sandpaper for his business.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a married woman with 2 children who attend school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Hidaya has operated a clothes selling business for the past 3 years; her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of female clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of female clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with 5 children, 1 of whom attends school while the others are working. Her husband is employed and contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

Riziki has operated a food stall for the past 12 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 22,500 she wants to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and rice for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new textiles designs for her business.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a 23-year-sold single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Neema has operated a farming supplies shop for the past 2 years; his potential clients are the local area farmers. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 he wants to purchase 5 boxes of pesticides and 10 boxes of maize seed for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 5 boxes of pesticides and 10 boxes of maize seed for resale.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with 5 children all of whom have completed school. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mesalimu has operated a fried fish selling business for the past 13 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of fish and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette has two children that attend school. She owns a bar and has spent one year in this business. She believes that after getting the loan she will buy a refrigerator. She will save her profits. She would like to be a distributor in the future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to use in her bar.

loans.name: Chaban

texts.en: Chaban is a father of 10 children; nine of them are enrolled in school. He is 37 years old. His wife is an art craft maker. He has spent 15 years selling pots for decorations. With the loan he will buy more pots for sale. These pots are used to decorate gardens. He says that the profits will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more decorative pots for sale.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maxima; continua con su trabajo de agricultura, la socia tiene su terreno en  el cual cultiva maíz, entre otros productos y tambien se dedica  al crianza de animales menores; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de sacos para cosechar su maíz, la socia tambien pagara  a los peones para cosechar el maiz y luego venderlo al por mayor, la socia tambien comprara aves de corral como gallinas y pollos para criarlos y luego venderlos; la socia desea poder trabajar un par de años mas a ese ritmo para ahorrar para su vejez y poder llevar una vida digna. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la cosecha de maíz y en la compra de gallinas y pollos.

 
La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maxima continues working on her land where she grows corn and other crops.  She also raises small animals.  The loan she is requesting is to buy sacks for the corn harvest and also to pay hired workers for the harvest.  She will sell the corn wholesale.  The member also wants to buy chickens to raise and sell.  She is hoping to work a few more years at this pace to save for retirement and to lead a decent lifestyle.  The loan is to invest in her corn crop and to buy chickens.

She is satisfied and grateful for the support received and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To invest in her corn crop and buy chickens.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 33 years old. She is married with two children aged 5 and 8; both were enrolled in school at the beginning of this year. Catherine sells used clothes and she has been selling clothes for the last 5 years. She has decided to request a loan to add more clothes to sell. With the profits, she plans to put aside savings in order to have enough money to help her build her residential house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La socia  Elizabeth; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores y ganados vacunos; La socia tiene toros y vacas, la socia comprara en esta ocasión un par de ganados tiernos para seguir incrementando su economia y para ello desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de 2 vacas tiernas. La socia con el ingreso que le dan la compra y venta de ganados ella puede seguir apoyando con la educacion y la alimentacion de sus hijos.
texts.en: The member, Elizabeth, continues with her small animal and cattle business.  She has bulls and cows and now wants to buy a pair of calves to increase her economy.  The loan will be used to purchase two young calves.  The income she receives from selling her livestock will be used to continue educating and supporting her children.

loans.use: To buy two young calves.

loans.name: Annim

texts.en:
Annim is 31 years old. She is married and has five children ranging from 3 to 11 years old. She is an aggressive and ambitious woman. For three years, she has been involved in a retail business where she sells airtime vouchers, cards and provides money transactions of the Safaricom company to repeat and walk-in customers. In addition, Annim runs a paraffin retail business to increase her income. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. 

She will be using the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy meat to start a new business of a butcher shop. In the future, Annim' s hope and dream is to run several butcher shops and venture into retail shops.

loans.use: To buy meat to start a new butcher shop business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUNCHASKAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 48 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería el elabora diversos trabajos como camas, armarios, estantes entre otros, el socio trabaja a pedido de acuerdo lo que le soliciten sus clientes, el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera para realizar sus trabajos.
El socio se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "HATUNCHASKAS", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

He is 48, has a common-law wife and two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his carpentry business where he makes beds, armoirs, and shelving, among other products.  He works on an order basis to customer demand.  He is cheerful and responsble, and very determined to get ahead for his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy wood for his business.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy wood for his business.

loans.name: Vestine.

texts.en: Vestine is 39 years old. She has no children yet. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver. She has spent 16 years selling pots for decoration. With the loan, she will buy more pots for decoration. She expects to use the profits for renovating the house. In the future, she dreams to start her business outside of the country because she has realized that the pots for decoration are really in demand.

loans.use: To buy more pots for decoration to sell.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 50 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 6 and 17.All of them go to school. She has been running a business selling clothes for the past three years. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Venantie plans to use the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees and provide food for the family. In the future, she would like to own a big shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 34 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas, es madre de 5 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, esta muy bien en Finca porque le da la seguridad y la estabilidad que no le dan otras entidades, aquí aprendió a ahorrar, a poder tener una base para un buen negocio, además la tranquilidad de su familia como de ella en lo económico, ahora compra frutas al por mayor y reparte.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para comprar la carga de un camión para poder vender al por menor las frutas.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Paloma community bank.  She is 34 years old and her business is selling fruit.  She is the mother of five children, is married, and has been a member of Finca Peru for five years.  She is very happy to be a member of Finca because it gives her security and stability which other institutions do not provide.  Here she has learned how to save, how to create the basis of a good business, and how to create financial harmony for herself and her family.  She now buys fruit wholesale and delivers them.  

Clementina will invest the loan that she is requesting in paying for a truck so that she can sell her fruit retail.

loans.use: to hire a truck with which to sell fruit

loans.name: Binita

texts.en:
Binita is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 8.  In 2002, she established her business making brass religious statues.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Binita plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, aged 25, is single. He he has been selling potatoes for the last two years. Emmanuel has requested the loan to buy more potatoes for sale. He will reinvest the profits from the business back into the business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 25 años, se dedica a la venta de cereales y siembra en la chacra, es madre de 1 hija, Maribel es hija única, y siempre apoya a su mamá porque es analfabeta, Maribel viaja con ella para ayudarle, se siente muy bien en Finca Perú ya que le ayuda a ella como a su mamá, los préstamo que les dan les enseñan a que sea invertido con sabiduría, aprende mucho, así como la forma de criar a su hija, gracias a Finca Perú y los préstamos recibidos pudo comprar un terreno, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cereales.
texts.en: Maribel is a member of the Paloma community bank.  She is 25 years old.  Her business is selling cereals and sowing crops on her farm.  She has one daughter.  Maribel is an only daughter and she always supports her mom because she is illiterate.  Maribel travels with her mom in order to help her.  She feels very happy to be part of Finca Peru as they help both her and her mom.  They teach her to invest the loans that they give her wisely.  She learns a lot, including how to raise her daughter.  Thanks to Finca Peru and the loans she has received from them, she has been able to buy a plot of land.  She will use this loan to invest in buying cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Nisha is 33 years-old. She is married and has two children aged 13 and 8. In 2004, she established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loans from Patan BPW and used it to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Nisha plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her business

loans.name: Mariam.

texts.en: Mariam is 49 years old. She has 7 children. All of her children go to school. Mariam has been selling flowers and pots used as decorations for 9 years. She will add more flowers and pots for sale. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children. She would like to run a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more flowers and pots for sale

loans.name: Djiguéne Bakhna 75 Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe de crédit Doleel Djiguéne 75 regroupe cinq femmes qui font parti d’une association de développement. Leur  activité consiste à faire  du commerce de divers produits : achats et vente de chaussures, habits prêt a porter, parfum, bijoux etc. 
Leur présidente, madame Nogaye  fait du commerce depuis plus de dix ans. Elle est mariée et responsable de famille car elle participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer  en appuyant son époux pour  le payement des frais de scolarité des  enfants .Avec l’épargne qu’elle réussi à mettre de coté, elle envisage dans l’avenir d’ouvrir un magasin.
texts.en:
The credit group Doleel Djiguéne 75 consists of five women who are part of a development association. Their business is to trade in a variety of products: buying and selling shoes, ready to wear clothing, perfume, jewelry, etc.

Their president, Madam Nogaye has been trading for more than ten years. She is married and responsible for her family because she contributes to her household's daily expenses leaning on her husband to pay the school fees for their children. With the savings that she manages to put aside, she envisions opening a store in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes, ready to wear clothing, jewelry and perfume.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 36 years-old. She is married and has two children aged 17 and 8. In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Parbati plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 37 years old. He is married with three children aged between 3 and 11. Two of them attend school. Faustin owns a convenience store which he has been running for the past four years. With the loan, he will buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other food items for sale. He plans to use the profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Osman.  He is married to a trader, and has 4 children aged 12, 9, 6 years and a 10 months old baby, two are school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he helps in the business. In 2005, Osman established his electronics business.  He began his business because of the rebel war that broke in his country of Sierra Leone. Osman says, "I was in form three (school grade 9 in the U.S) when the rebels attacked us in our village called Sanda twenty miles off from Makeni. Then we fled to Makeni and started working for people for our survival. During that time, I started raising funds until I got a substantial amount to start my business." Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,796,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 . Osman has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now needs a new loan in order to buy tape (6 batteries) - 8 pieces @ Lr125,000, radio - 10 pieces @ Le45,000, radio with memory card - 5 pieces @ Le75,000, tape (4 batteries) - 8 pieces @ Le65,000 and electronic lanterns - 1 carton @ Le1,000,000.  The balance will be used for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 269,000. In the future, Osman plans to open a shop. He felt good about taking out this loan as it helps him to boost his business.  He wants his children to have a good education. The loan will help greatly because he will be able to make a profit out of it.  Increases in the cost of goods affects him greatly because as costs change, he has to change his selling prices which affects his customers' buying pattern.  He offers quality products.  Osman serves at least 20 people per day around the city.  His business is popular because he treats his customers fairly and with respect.  He is assisted by family members. He buys his goods in Conakry twice per month and in Freetown once every week.  He saves some of his profit, some he uses to add to his working capital. He plans to expand if he is given subsequent loans that will enable him to accomplish his dreams.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy electronics for sale

loans.name: Ziripa

texts.en: Ziripa is 50 years old. She has 5 children aged between 16 and 29. Two of them go to school. Ziripa has spent 3 years in the business of selling clothes. She has requested the loan to buy more clothes for sale. With the profits, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 46 years-old. She is married and has 2 children aged 25 and 14.  In 2000, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Gita plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 49 year-old Isatu. She is a widow and has 1 child aged 24 years. She has 2 additional dependents. In 1980, Isatu established her essential drugs (tablets, syrups, pain killers) business. She began her business because she dropped out of school when she became pregnant by her late husband. Her parents asked her to marry him as they thought it was the best decision.  Since her dreams of going to medical school were shattered, she was given some amount of money after given birth, which she used to start selling medication. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 3,585,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy the following medication: Panadol - 1 carton @ Le440,000, ORS - 1 carton @ Le340,000, hot rubs - 4 bundles @ Le150,000, cold rubs - 2 cartons @ Le150,000, dexoranges - 4 carton @ Le220,000 and haemporte - 2 carton @ Le220,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 538,000. In the future, Isatu plans to complete her unfinished building. She felt good as this loan is helping her to improve her business.  She is nervous about the future. She hopes for her adopted children to have a good education.  The loan will serve as another source of income.  

Changes in government policies such as increases in taxes are her problem, but in terms of competition, it is moderate as she only has one competitor in that area.  She serves patients from the nearby hospital and retailers, about 50 people per day.  Her business is popular because she has good customer care and offers a legal business.  Isatu usually buys her drugs in Freetown twice per month using public transport.  She uses some of her profit for the construction of her house and the rest as additional capital for her business.  She is honest and hardworking. Her business is improving and she hopes to acquire more loans to develop her business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medication for sale

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 28 years old and single. She owns a boutique selling cell phones and accessories. With the loan, she will buy more accessories and cell phones to sell. Odette will use the profits to solve the home problems. She would like to have a house in which she will reside in the future.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories.

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Doña Martha, continua laborando, como cajera, y el ingreso de un cuarto que alquila, logrando a si, equilibrar sus gastos, atraves da estos años, su meta ha sido mejorar su casa, en donde lo ha venido logrando, con financiamientos.
Hoy en dia, desea subir paredes, mas altas en su casa, ya que la alcaldia, reparo calles y echo tierra, lo que las calles, quedaron altas, quedando su casa en bajo, y desea hacer esta mejora, ante que las correntada del invierno, le inunden, quedando paredes de enfrente, al igual que la calle. Lo que comprara materiales de construccion en piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para comenzar la obra. Dando seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha continues working as a cashier and making income from a room which she rents out.  This helps her to cover her expenses.  Over the years, her goal has been to improve her house and she has been managing this through loans.

Martha would currently like to build higher walls in her home as the council repaired the roads and raised the ground at the same time which meant that the streets became higher and her home was left lower than the level of the road.  She would like to make this improvement before the winter comes and she gets flooded.  She would like her front walls to be level with the street.  In order to achieve this, she will buy building supplies ( stone, sand, cement and iron) and start the work.  This will provide her family with security.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that she can start building concrete walls at the front of her home

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: La socia Ubaldina; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de animales, la socia  la socia sigue criando sus animale smenore y sus ganaditos, ella tambien vende los derivados de la leche como son yogurth, queso, mantequilla; la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de un ganado vacuno ternero.
texts.en:
The member Ubaldina continues in the business of buying and selling animals. The member is raising her small animals and her livestock. She also sells dairy products such as yogurt, cheese, and butter. 

The member is asking for a loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: El socio Rufino; continua con su negocio de venta de medicina natural, el socio es curandero y ejerce esta labor desde hace 40 años atrás motivo por el cual continua y continuara haciendo esto hasta que las fuerzas le acompañen manifiesta el socio; el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de sus ingredientes como son hierbas naturales y  raíces, cebos de animales y hierbas al por mayor. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de estos productos naturales para la elaboracion de sus medicinas.
texts.en:
