The member Rufino continues in the business of selling natural medicine. He is a healer and has been doing this activity for forty years. The motive behind going on and on doing this is the strength that comes with manifestation.

The member at this time wants to use the money from the loan to buy ingredients such as natural herbs and roots, animal baits and wholesale herbs.

The member is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of these natural products for the making of his medicine.

loans.use: to buy natural products for the preparation of his medicine

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La socia Nancy; continua con la crianza de animales menores, como  cuyes, ovejas, chanchos, vacas. y tambien con la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz, y en esta ocasión la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animale smenores como cuyes y en la cosecha del maíz para ello la socia contratara obreros para que le ayuden con esta cosecha y luego poder vender la cosecha de maíz. LA SOCIA SOLICIATE L PRESTAMO PARA LA COSECHA DE MAIZ Y COMPRA DE CUYES.
texts.en:
The member Nancy continues with the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs, sheep, pigs, cows, and also in agriculture.

The member has land for growing corn and at this time she is asking for a loan in order to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and to pay the workers she contracts to help in the harvesting of corn and later she can sell the harvested corns.

The member is asking for a loan in order to harvest corn and to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to pay the workers to harvest the corn and to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Canisia

texts.es: La socia Canisia; Continua con su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, gallinas, y los lelva a vender en la feria, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ganados vacunos como dos vacas terneras para incrementar uss ventad y mejorar sus ganacias para poder apoyar a sus hijos en la educacion y en cuanto a la calidad de vida. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de dos ganados vacunos terneros.
texts.en: The communal bank member Canisia continues with her business of buying and selling livestock. She raises guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, and chickens, and sells them at the local market fair. Canisia, on this occasion, wishes to buy cattle, specifically 2 calves, to increase her sales and improve her earnings, in order to pay for her childrens' education and improve their quality of life. Her loan will be used to buy the 2 calves.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: El socio Juan Bautista; continua con el cuidado y adninistracion de su terreno de cultivo y a la crianza de cuyes, el socio continua creciendo de a poco pero en esta ocasión el desea invertir su credito en la compra de 200 cuyes para incrementar su negocio y aún tiene el sueño de hacer un camal de cuyes con todas las condiciones para que la gente vaya a comprar cuyes finos y bien criados en su camal. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir  en la compra de 200 cuyes.
texts.en: This member, Juan Bautista, continues to care for and run his farm and raise guinea pigs.  He continues to grow little by little.  Currently he would like to buy 200 guinea pigs with his loan to increase his business and he still has a dream of building a guinea pig slaughterhouse with all the conditions for people to come and buy high-quality, well-raised animals.  He is requesting a loan to buy 200 guinea pigs.

loans.use: purchase 200 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jakeline Zarauz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Jakeline; continua con su negocio minorista de compra y venta de animales menores, como pollos, gallinas, cuyes, y también compra y vende vacas y toros; en esta ocasión la socia quiere invertir el prestamo en la compra de vacasa terneras, ella compra las alimenta engorda, si tienes bebes los cria y luego vende las vacas y toros maduros. La socia Solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de un par de vacas 
terneras.
texts.en: The communal bank member Jakeline continues in her retail business of buying and selling farm animals such as chickens, hens, guinea pigs, and also cows and bulls. On this occasion, Jakeline wishes to buy calves. She buys and fattens them and if they have babies, she raises these and later sells the mature cows and bulls. Jakeline is currently requesting a loan to buy a pair of calves.

loans.use: to buy a pair of calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Irene Soraida

texts.es:
Irene es una mujer de 19 años, muy honesta, alegre y trabajadora. Irene vive con sus padres en Tulcán que es la Capital de la Provincia del Carchi.

Irene trabaja con su madre en la crianza de cerdos rosados y blancos. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de balanceado para la alimentación de sus cerdos ya que quiere engordarles para poder sacarles a la venta, también usará este crédito para la compra de crías de cerdos blancos para engorde y su posterior venta. Este proceso ayudará a Irene a incrementar su negocio y crecer su propio capital para en un futuro poder formar una familia y sustentar los gastos.

Irene desea seguir trabajando para poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irene is a 19-year-old, very honest, happy, and hard-working woman. She lives with her parents in Tulcan, the capital of Carchi Province.

Irene works with her mother in raising  pink and white pigs. This is the 2nd loan she has solicited through FODEMI, and she will invest it in buying feed for her pigs so she can fatten them to sell. Also, she will use the loan to buy more white pigs to fatten and later sell. This process will help Irene to expand her business and increase her own capital for the future, enabling her to form a family and cover future expenses.

Irene wants to continue working in order to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy feed for her pigs and also more white pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Naranjito Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Naranjito, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora  Francisca. Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con once 11 integrantes, ellas son de la oficina de Curuguaty. Todas ellas demuestran responsabilidad  y la solidaridad las unas con las otras.
Perla es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser cerdos, y pollitos. Ella cuenta que su trabajo es muy duro, pues siempre debe de estar pendiente de sus animales y cuidarlos. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido ayudar y sostener a su familia día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para los animales que cría, de esa forma podrá tener un buen stock y no quedarse vacía.
texts.en:
The “Naranjito” committee formed thanks to Francisca’s initiative.  They are currently in the second cycle with 11 members.  They all are from the Curuguaty office.  All are responsible and mutually supportive.

Perla is a group member.  She raises animals like pigs and chicks.  She comments that her work is very hard because she must always be watchful of her animals and care for them.  Through this work she’s been able to help support her family day by day.

She’s asking for the loan to buy feed for the animals she raises so that she can have a good stock and not run out.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mibeko Plus Group

texts.en:
“Mibeko Plus”, which means Laws in English, is a group of 16 owners of small businesses chaired by Etoyi. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Etoyi has been selling second hand clothing since 1985. She started her business with a beginning capital of USD 150. Over the years, her business prospered through determination and hard work. She has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business. With good management and savings, Etoyi has been able to increase her working capital today. She sells at the market and her business makes $40 per week. She is confident with her business and she is determined to someday diversify her business by adding beverages. Etoyi is 48 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 18 and 24. All of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of second hand clothing to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: La socia  Edelmira; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de bebidas y de comidas, la socia elabora las diferentes comidas y las sigue llevando a vender a la feria. La socia desea poder invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos e ingredientes como arroz, azucar, fideos, aceite y continuara elaborando sus potajes para la venta y comprar gaseosas para increentar sus ventas. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de gaseosas y de ingredientes para elaborar sus diversos potajes.
texts.en: Edelmira continues with her business  buying and selling beverages and food.  She makes a variety of dishes that she continues to take to the street markets to sell.  She wants to use the loan to buy supplies and ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles and oil to continue making her dishes to sell and to buy soft-drinks to increase her sales.  She’s asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of soft-drinks and ingredients to make her various dishes.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Elena de 59 años de edad es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, ella es viuda y tiene 04 hijos independientes. Para salir adelante Elena se ha dedicado a distintas actividades comerciales, como a la venta de abarrotes y de útiles escolares, actualmente brinda servicio de cocina, la cual lleva trabajando de esta manera más 07 años, gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su nieto con su educación. El deseo de Elena es de habilitar un espacio en su vivienda donde, pueda ofrecer bebidas como gaseosas, agua mineral y cervezas pues así asegura tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para gastos de medicamentos para su nieto ya que se encuentra delicado de salud.  Elena agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Elena, 59, is a responsible, hardworking woman.  She’s a widow and has four independent children.  To get ahead, Elena has worked in a variety of commercial activities like selling groceries and school supplies.  She currently works as a cook and has been working at this for seven years.  Thanks to her effort and work she’s managed to improve her house and support her grandson’s education.  

Elena would like to equip a room in her house to sell beverages like soft-drinks, mineral water and beer because she’s sure to have more profits that way.  On his occasion, she asked for the loan to buy medicine for her grandson who is currently in delicate health.  Elena thanks Kiva lenders for supporting people like her.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her grandson.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 41 años de edad, es casada con un hijo.

Ella se ha dedicado durante toda su vida a realizar oficios domésticos, pero desde hace ocho años se dedica a trabajar en su granja de pollos de engorde, esta idea surgió de su hermana. Además ella posee una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su casa.

Blanca solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 200 pollitos, 4 quintales de concentrado de inicio, 16 quintales de concentrado final de engorde, vacunas, mejorar la galera donde tiene sus pollos y para comprar más productos para su tienda. 

Todo esto lo comprara en una ciudad del oriente del país que esta a cuatro kilómetros y medio de su hogar. Con esta inversión ella poseerá una granja mejor y fortalecerá su tienda, con lo que recibirá mayores ingresos, que parte de ellos los ahorrara, ya que desea brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Más adelante Blanca piensa en comprar cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos, realizarle mejoras a su casa, tener mucho más dinero ahorrado, abastecer las necesidades de su comunidad con su tienda y con la granja ya que en ese lugar no hay solo la de ella.
texts.en:
Blanca is 41 years old, married and has a son.  She has spent her life doing domestic chores but for the last 8 years has been working raising chickens, an idea that her sister gave her.  She also has a small, home-based store with basic household staples.

She asked Fundación Campo for a loan to buy 200 chicks, 4 quintals of start-up concentrate, 16 quintals of last-stage concentrate and vaccines; to improve the coops and to buy more products for her store.

She will buy all of this in a city in the east of the country that’s four and a half kilometers from home.  With this investment she’ll have a better farm and she’ll strengthen her store which will lead to better income.  She will save part of it because she wants to give her family a better quality of life.

Later on, Blanca plans to buy pigs to fatten up and sell, to do some home improvements, to have much more money saved, to meet her community’s needs with her store and the farm because in her areas hers is the only one.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks, 4 quintals of start-up concentrate, 16 quintals of last-stage concentrate, vaccines, to improve the coops and to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Moisson Plus Group

texts.en:
Adele is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Moisson Plus”, which means “Harvest” in English. The group is composed of 24 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Adele, 43, became a micro-entrepreneur in 2009. She manages her own general store in the east of Kinshasa. She works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her area. Her business brings in $40 per week. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by purchasing soaps, cans, sacks of beans and sugar, and milk and reselling them at a profit. Adele is married and the mother of five children whose ages vary between 4 and 15 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to buy soaps, cans, sugar, beans and toilet items to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una de la miembros quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Es por eso que lleva por nombre las amigas, ya que todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad.
La sra. Wilfrida es una de las miembros, quien nos cuneta que se dedica a la costura y decoracion, ella está casada con el Señor Jorge hace 5 años, tiene un hijo de 3 años.. Wilfrida sueña con habilitar un salon de venta de ropas y decoracion y lograr asi brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y tambien seguir ayudando a su marido ocn los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los elementos de trabajo que usa, como ser telas, hilos, goma, tijera, acesorio de costura y demás insumos. Ella al igual que sus amigas, agradecen a la fundación paraguaya y a kiva.
texts.en:
The contact to initiate the present group was one of the members, who invited and organized her friends to become part of the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program. This is why she  calls all her friends by name, since they are all friends and neighbors in this city.

Señora Wilfrida is one of the members, who tells us that her work is sewing and decoration. She has been married to Señor Jorge for 5 years, and she has a son who is 3 years old. Wilfrida dreams of setting up a store to sell clothing and decorations and to succeed this way in offering a better life style to her family and also to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

She is applying for the loan to purchase the resources that she uses for work, such as fabrics, threads, elastic, scissors, sewing accessories, and other items. She, like her friends, is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, scissors, sewing accessories, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase school supplies and uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nueva Esperanza, pertenece al primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, ellas son 12 señoras que realizan diversas actividades microemprendedoras entre ellas se destacan ventas de ropas, leche, bijouterie, ventas y elaboración de comestibles.
Bettina es una de las miembros y ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo puede sentirse útil y ayudar a su familia. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de alimentos de todo tipo y dice que gracias a su buena sazón ya pudo ganarse muchos clientes, lo cual le es de mucha ayuda. Su meta es poder tener un gran comedor y de esa forma servir sus ricos alimentos a más personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, jamón, queso, condimentos, hortalizas y demás insumos necesarios para elaborar los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank belongs to the first cycle of the foundation's program for women entrepreneurs.  They are 12 women who do different jobs in small businesses, among which these stand out: clothing sales, milk, jewelry, sales, and making food.

Bettina is one of the members, and she comments that through this work she is able to feel useful and help her family.  She says she works selling all types of food and thanks to her good seasoning she already managed to get many new customers, which is a big help to her.  Her goal is to be able to have a big dining room and in this way serve her delicious dishes to more people.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, ham, cheese, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies necessary to make the dishes she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, ham, cheese, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 39 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with two children between 11 and 24 years old. Two of her children are in school and live at home. Alice has been involved in business for the past 10 years. She started this business with hairdressing and currently she sells palm oil. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the future, she wants to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Está separada de su esposo, pero vive con sus 03 hijos en casa de su padre. La actividad que realiza Dalila es la venta de comida rápida como salchipollos, pollos broasters y alitas fritas, además de menú y desayunos que da pensión a los trabajadores de un taller de mecánica cerca de su casa. Su puesto de venta lo instala en el frontis de su casa, desde donde viene atendiendo hace 05 años muy amablemente a sus clientes, contando además con la ayuda de su hermana para la preparación y atención al público, pagándole diariamente por su colaboración. Le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que en el pasado sufrió un accidente que le imposibilitó trabajar en una empresa y cuando se recuperó viendo la necesidad de tener un oficio se decidió por iniciare en éste negocio. Ahora ve que le es rentable, por ello decide continuar hacer crecer su negocio y con el tiempo abrir un restaurante en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los piensa invertir en la compra de mesas y sillas, además de utensilios de cocinas como ollas, cucharas, platos para implementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Dalila, 47, is a hardworking and enterprising woman, as well as being pleasant and happy.  She is separated from her husband but lives with her three children in her father's house.  The work she does is selling fast food such as "salchipollos" [potatoes, sausage, and fried chicken], roast chicken, and fried wings, as well as a menu and breakfasts to feed the workers in a mechanic shop near her house.

She sets up her sales stall in the façade of her house, from where she has been waiting on her customers very pleasantly for five years.  She also has the help of her sister in food preparation and waiting on the public, and pays her daily for her help.

She likes her job because it allows her to have income to pay for the household expenses.  In the past she had an accident that made it impossible for her to work in a company.  When she recovered, seeing the need to have a trade she decided to get started in this business.  Now she sees that it is profitable for her, so she decided to continue making her business grow and in time open a restaurant in her house.

This will be her second loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes for a small loan so she can realize her goals.  In addition, she feels comfortable with her communal bank because she considers them to be good people.

With the requested loan of 800 PEN she plans to invest in buying tables and chairs as well as kitchen utensils such as pots, spoons, and plates, to be able to set up her business more.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs as well as kitchen utensils, pots, spoons, and plates.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
8 de Diciembre es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, las señoras están muy esperanzadas en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras, es por ello que se unieron y de esa forma trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Son personas muy emprendedoras y trabajadoras, que desean poder ayudar a sus familias.
Maria es una de estas mujeres trabajadoras, ella comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser de chanchos, gallinas y patos. Ella dice que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y cansador, pero que pese a ello le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto, además de eso es el sustento principal de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos y patos pequeños, además de alimentos para estos, lo cual será de mucha ayuda para ella. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la gran oportunidad de progreso que le da.
texts.en:
The December 8th Group is from the city of Curuguaty. The women have put a lot of hope in the program for women in business. For this reason they got together to work and help one another. They are very entrepreneurial and hard-working people who desire to help their families.

Maria is one of these hard-working women. She shares that she works raising and selling animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. She says her work requires a lot of sacrifice and is tiring, but she really enjoys what she does, and it is a dignified and honest job. Additionally, it is her family's main source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy chicks and small ducks, and food for these birds. This loan will help her a lot. She is thankful to the foundation and Kiva for providing the opportunity to get ahead..

loans.use: To buy chicks and young ducks to raise and food for the animals.

loans.name: Todos Juntos Podemos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group, Todos juntos podemos, "All together we can" 1, 2 & 3. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The group is composed of 15 micro entrepreneurs dedicated to selling miscellaneous products, by walking or from their house. Marie makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children, being a single mother for many years. She is dedicated to working hard to provide her house income for clothing, food, education and other things.

Marie is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing for women and kids and some pairs of shoes. She will use her business profits to save and build her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 39 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with three children between 9 and 23 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past 22 years, Hawa has been selling doughnuts and meat pies. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit and has a little income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, and coal for her business. Her plan is to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, and coal for her business

loans.name: Esther I.

texts.es: Esther tiene 57 años de edad es casada con 05 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Esther es una mujer empeñosa, que con los deseos de superarse y de contar con un negocio propio estudió corte confección lo que pudo ahorrar con sus trabajos  para la compra de su primera  máquinas de coser, debido a la demanda de clientes en su zona adquirió otra máquina  , actualmente cuenta con dos maquinas de coser. Ella se siente orgullosa ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y actualmente a poyar a uno de sus nietos. El deseo de Esther es de comprase otra máquina de coser. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de telas y también lo usara para la graduación de su hijo.  Esther agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por el apoyo que brindan a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Esther is 57, married, and has five children. She is still supporting one of them. Esther is a determined woman, who through her wish to better herself, and to have her own business, studied dressmaking, and was able to save through her work to buy her first sewing machine.

Due to the demand from customers in her area, she acquired another machine. Now she has two sewing machines. 

She feels proud, that thanks to her hard work and dediucation she has been able to support her children with their education, and now supports one of her grandchildren. 

Esther wishes to buy herself another sewing machine. On this occasion, she applied for the loan in order to buy fabric and will also use it to pay graduation expenses for her son. Esther is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support that they offer to people like her.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Tina W.

texts.en: Tina is 33 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with two children between 4 and 12 years old. Both of them are in school and live at home.  For the past eight years, she has been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her brother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Llegando Lejos 1 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, Llegando Lejos (Going Far) 1 & 5. Her story is representative of her group's members, who are Haitin borrowers living in the Dominican Republic to attain a better future. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is portable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their children.

Ana is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling empanadas (a fried treat usually made of meat or cheese encased in fried dough). She will be purchasing cooking oil, flour, meat, cheese, ham, eggs and vegetables. This is a popular food, specially for a snack, breakfast or dinner. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children and for saving to one day own her own home. Ana thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, meat, cheese, vegetables, ham, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Kuña Rory es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y por sobre todo muy idealistas, ya que tienen muchos sueños que cumplir.  Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 1º ciclo con 11 integrantes, ellas siempre se esfuerzan al máximo por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra Hilaria se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es un alimento típico de Paraguay. Comenta que tiene muy buena venta ya que la chipa es muy consumida, haga frío o calor. Por medio de sus ventas ella ha podido sostener los gastos que día a día surgen en el hogar. Su sueño es poder tener algún día una gran chipería para que de esa forma se convierta en una distribuidora y pueda dar trabajo a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de almidón, manteca, huevos, sal y demás insumos para poder hacer las chipas que vende. Están, todas ellas, muy agradecidas a kiva y fundación por la oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
The committee called 'Kuña Rory' is from the city of Carapeguá. The group members are hard workers, entrepreneurs and above all idealists who have many dreams to fulfill. The group is currently in it's first cycle and has 11 members. They always put in their best effort to be able to move ahead and help their families. 

One of the group members, Hilaria, makes a living selling chipas (a small, baked cheese bun), which is a traditional food of Paraguay. She told us that she has a good business and that chipas are frequently eaten, hot or cold. With the profits from her business she has been able to sustain the daily costs that arise in her home. Her dream is to be able to one day have a large business where she makes chipas, so that she can become a distributor and be able to give work to other people. 

Hilaria requests a loan to buy starch, lard, eggs, salt and other ingredients to be able to make the chipas that she sells. 

Everyone in the group is very thankful to Kiva and to Fundación for the opportunity they have received.

loans.use: to buy starch, lard, eggs, salt and other ingredients.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has three children between 2 and 10 years old. Two of her children are in school and all of them live at home.  

For the past three years, Janet has been selling fashion clothes. She started this business with money loaned to her by her friend. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. In the future, Janet wants to build a house and buy a car for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Los Semilleros De Huepil Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Semilleros de Huepil” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de ensaladas, venta de joyas, venta de lencería, reparación de calzado, confección de ropa, peluquería, venta de alimentos congelados, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Jessica delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, en el lugar del medio, viste un vestido estampado con diferentes colores negro, amarillo, verde, fucsia, Calipso, usa su cabello suelto con flequillo y es de color caoba.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva para dama. Desde hace un año aproximadamente.
Su mercadería la compra por internet o la compra directamente en el barrio Patronato, comprando modelos exclusivos.
Su horario de trabajo es flexible y sus clientes son conocidos y cercanos a su casa.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para dama, específicamente blusas.
Una de las metas para su negocio, es tener una boutique en la cual pueda ofrecer su mercadería de una manera más atractiva y cómoda para atraer más clientela.
Jessica vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 13, 5 y 2 años de edad, uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es estudiar una carrera con alguna especialidad en idiomas.
Ella además está muy contenta, motivada y agradecida en participar de Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y aprender nuevas técnicas para mejorar la contabilidad de su negocio. Comenta que el grupo es muy comprometido y que las reuniones son muy amenas. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Los Semilleros de Huepil, is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including salad preparation, jewelry sales, lingerie sales, shoe repair, tailoring, hairdressing, and frozen food sales, among other businesses.  All of them are in the city of Chillán.

Jessica is the delegate of the communal bank group.  In the photo she is in the middle of the front row, wearing a Calypso dress printed with different colors, black, yellow, green, fuchsia.  She wears her mahogany-colored hair loose with bangs.

She has worked selling new clothing for women for approximately a year.  She buys her merchandise on the Internet or directly in her Patronato neighborhood, buying exclusive styles.  Her work schedule is flexible and her customers are acquaintances and close to her house.

With the loan she will buy women's clothing, specifically blouses.

One of her goals for her business is to have a boutique in which she can offer her merchandise in a more attractive and comfortable way, to attract more customers.

Jessica lives with her husband and three children, ages 13, 5, and 2.  One of her personal dreams is to study some field with a specialization in languages.

In addition, she is very happy, motivated, and grateful to participate in Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business and learn new techniques to improve the accounting in her business.  She comments that the group is very committed and the meetings enjoyable.

Chillán is a village in the south-central part of Chile. The name means "Chair of the Sun" in Mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuche.  Chillán is known as the "Birthplace of the Country" or "Land of the Artists" because in this region many of the great figures of Chilean history were born, such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, specifically blouses.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has three children between 1 and 11 years old. Two of her children are in school and all of them live at home.  

For the past three years, Mercy has been selling soap and sugar. She started this business with money given to her by her friend. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap and sugar for her business. In the future, Mercy wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and sugar for her business.

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Juan II” se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 13 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas con las cuales desean poder ayudar a sus familias. Todas se esmeran esperanzadas, para poder dar a sus hijos un futuro  mejor del que a ellas les toca vivir.
Rosa es una de las integrantes, ella nos comenta que vende todo tipo de prendas, las cuales vende a muy buenos precios, ya que son de muy buena calidad, pero a bajo costo. Eso le ha ayudado a tener una buena clientela que la ayuda a tener mayores ingresos. Ella comenta que su sueño es poder tener una tienda para ofrecer mayor comodidad y variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Juan II” committee is in its first cycle in the Mujeres Emprendedoras ["Women Entrepreneurs"] program in Fundacion Paraguaya. The group has 13 members and is located in the Asuncion zone. All of the members already have businesses with which they hope to help their families. They all try very hard with a great deal of hope; they work to be able to give their children a better future, better than what they have lived.
Rosa is one of the group members. She tells us that she sells all types of garments at very good prices. Her garments are of very high quality but low cost. This has allowed her to have a good customer base and income. She tells us that her dream is to be able to have a store in order to offer her clients more comfort and variety.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of summer clothing, with which she will be able to stock up and have a variety of garments to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy garments for the next sale.

loans.name: Alaxpacha Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALAXPACHA II” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Gladys. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de edredones, comercio de abarrotes, venta de producto YAMBAL, costura de chamarras, trenzado de mantas, venta de queso, compra y venta de productos.

La señora Gladys,  indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de edredones usados que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que comprará de La Paz  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias y otros departamentos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “ALAXPACHA II” loan group will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the central focus of Germán Busch. The group is made up of eight members and is led by Mrs. Gladys. The group members work in a variety of businesses including: sewing comforters, selling groceries, selling Yanbal products (jewelry and cosmetics), sewing jackets, weaving blankets, selling cheese, and buying products for resale.

Mrs. Gladys shares that she joined Pro Mujer two loan cycles ago, and that she joined the institution after a friend invited her. She currently has a business sewing and also selling used comforters. She has done this work for many years.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (buy fabric) from La Paz and later sell in markets and fairs. This job allows her to earn money to support her family. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes sharing with her group members.

loans.use: buy fabric

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El comité “Divino Niño” se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras, tiene 12 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras  luchadora, que tienen un gran deseo de superación y crecimiento.
Eudelia es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, ella se dedica al reciclaje de plásticos, botellas, catones y demás. Dice que recorre por las calles buscando esos productos y que acaba el día muy cansada, ya que se levanta muy temprano. Cuenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos, pues al revenderlos tendrá un poco más de ganancias. Agradece la oportunidad que recibe por parte de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño” (Divine Child) Group is in their first loan cycle with the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) program. There are twelve group members from the Asunción area. They are all very hard-working women with a great desire for achievement and growth.

Eudelia is very sacrificial and hard-working. She works recycling plastics, bottles, cardboard, and more. She says she goes through the streets looking for these products and ends the day very tired, since she gets up very early. She shares that she is very proud of what she does, because it is dignified and honest work.

She is asking for a loan to buy plastic products that she can resell to earn a little money. She is thankful for the opportunity she is provided from Kiva and the Paraguayan Foundation.

loans.use: buy plastics for resale

loans.name: Llegando Lejos 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group, Llegando Lejos (Going Far) 2 & 5. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seybo, an agricultural area. This group includes 10 Haitian and Dominican members who have businesses selling shoes, clothing, cosmetics and many other items.

Regina plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which is a fried food or patty stall, where she sells meat, fried plantains, dough, chicken and many other goods but her specialty is fried foods. She will be purchasing meat, plantains, chicken, cooking oil, flour, etc. She is excited to be taking out her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanding her business. She will save her profits to reinvest in her business.

Regina makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner and their five children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them. In the meantime, she enjoys attending church. She thanks you for supporting her and her group.

loans.use: to buy meat, plantains, chicken, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa además de ser amable y solidaria. Está casada con Ronald quien es docente, y fruto de esa unión tiene 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su porpia casa en compañía de su suegra. La actividad que realiza Elsa es la confección y venta de ropa intima de damas y niños, para lo cual cuenta con una maquina de coser que compró con sus ahorros, y aprendiendo por cuenta. Tiene más de 03 años realizando está actividad, y hoy ha crecido su negocio y tiene mucha demanda de sus confecciones, asimismo su hermana la aestá ayudando y poco a poco aprendiendo del negocio. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que puede contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Por lo contrario no le gusta, el cansancio físico que le ocasiona por estar en una misma postura, pero aún así desea continuar trabajando y ampliar su negocio confeccionando faldas y blusas para surtir su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta estar cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para costura como telas, blondas elásticos y otros.
texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who is also kind and supportive.  She’s married to Ronald who is a teacher and they have three children.  They live together in their own house with her mother-in-law.  

Elsa’s activity is making and selling women’s and children’s intimate wear.  To do so, she has a sewing machine that she bought with her savings and learned on her own.  She’s been in this activity for more than three years and today the business has grown quite a bit and her items are in high demand.  Her sister is helping her and gradually learning the business.  

She enjoys what she does because she can count on steady income to help her husband with household expenses.  On the other hand, she dislikes the physical fatigue being in the same position causes but even so wants to continue working and expanding the business making skirts and blouses to stock her business.

This will be MFP loan #2 so she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue with her objectives.  On the other hand, she comments that she’s comfortable in her communal bank’s group because she considers the members to be responsible and supportive.   She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy sewing supplies like fabric, lace, elastic and others.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Flor De Azucena Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE AZUCENA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulema es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de licores, venta de calzados, venta de pollos, a la brosther, venta de fruta, venta de pantalones.

La señora Zulema,  indica que es la primera vez trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de pollos a ala brosther que viene trabajando hace años y aprendiendo el mismo de sus anteriores trabajos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pollos) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la forografía no aparese la señora Raquel, por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Azucena” (Easter Lilly) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada focal center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Zulema, the President.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: food sales, liquor sales, shoe sales, Broaster-style chicken sales, fruit sales and pants sales.

Zulema indicates that this is the first time she’s worked in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through an invitation from a friend.  She currently sells Broaster-style chickens, a business she’s had for several years having learned it from previous jobs.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her working capital.  She’ll buy chickens in La Ceja and once ready will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s single.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.  

Raquel, for cultural reasons, does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: 6 De Junio 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE JUNIO 2” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Costura de chamarras y poleras, lentes por mayor, tienda de aceite, carpintería, carnicería, tejido de mantas.

La señora Amalia,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un taller de costura de deportivos que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en conjunto.
texts.en:
The “6 de Junio 2” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada focal center.  It has six members headed by a governing board led by Amalia, the President.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have: manufacturing jackets and t-shirts, selling eyeglasses at wholesale, an oil store, carpentry, butcher shop and blanket weaving.

Amalia indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for a year having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters.  She currently has a sewing shop where she manufactures athletic wear that she’s had for several years now.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her working capital.  She will buy fabric in La Ceja and once made will sell them in street markets.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that it’s the teamwork.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Elita

texts.es: Elita, de 64 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Es viuda pero vive en compañía de su hija de 34 años de edad y sus 02 nietos a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Elita es la venta de bebidas gaseosas y parrillada en su propia casa, con lo cual se ahorra pagar gastos de alquiler. Es así que su negocio lo instala en el frontis de su casa, donde coloca una mesa todos los fines de semana y venden sus parrilladas, logrando tener una buena acogida entres sus clientes, asimsimo su hija es quien la ayuda desde hace 06 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos que necesita para pagar los gastos de su hogar, por tanto desea continuar trabajando logrando consolidar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo de contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con sus negocio. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues los considera ser un grupo solidario y unido. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas a precio por mayor de diversos sabores para así tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elita, 64, is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She’s a widow but lives with her 34-year-old daughter and her two grandchildren who she loves very much.  They live together in a house of their own.  Elita’s activity is selling soft-drinks and grilled meat from home to save on rental costs.  She sets up her business in her front yard.  She sets up a table every weekend and sells her grilled meats; she is well received by her customers.  Her daughter has been helping her for the last six years.  She likes the business because it generates the income she needs to pay for household expenses so would like to stay in business and consolidate it.

This will be MFP loan #2.  She feels grateful to have a line of credit’s support to stay in business.  She also feels good in her communal bank because it’s a very united and supportive group.  She will use the requested 1200 new soles to buy assorted flavored beverages at wholesale prices in order to earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of beverages.

loans.name: Gladys Judith

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive en la parroquia del Valle  conocida también como “San Bautista de El Valle que se encuentra situada al sureste de Cuenca, lugar donde se produce de maíz, entre sus atractivos podemos destacar la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras), su gente es amable gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Doña Gladys tiene 26 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 7 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora Gladys hace algunos años trabaja como empleada domestica, labora solo el medio día. En su casa se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y también cría y vende cerdos y pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y materiales de construcción para acabar su casa. 

Su meta es tener un negocio estable como una tienda.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Cochapamba” communal bank.  She lives in El Valle Parish also known as “San Bautista de El Valle” and is located southeast of Cuenca.  It is a corn producing zone.  Among its attractions we can point out the Cochapamba Lagoon (full of Totora reeds).  Its residents are kind and maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.  They are merchants, farmers and raise animals.

Gladys is 26 years old and has a 7-year-old son attending the local elementary school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  The house she lives in his hers.

Gladys has worked as a domestic employee for several years; she works half days.  At home, she cares for her son and also raises pigs and chickens to sell.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and will use her new loan to buy pigs and building supplies to finish her house.  Her goal is to have a stable business like a store.

loans.use: to buy pigs and building supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Aidee

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive en la parroquia del Valle conocida también como “San Bautista de El Valle” que se encuentra situada al sureste de Cuenca,  lugar donde se produce maíz, entre sus atractivos podemos destacar la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras), su gente es amable gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
La Señora. Blanca tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 17 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija  en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Blanca se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su familia, como pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en casa cría cerdos, pollos y cuyes que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica  y también son para el consumo de su hogar.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 12 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos, cuyes y  alimento para animales.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the “Cochapamba” communal bank in El Valle Parish also known as “San Juan Bautista de El Valle” that’s located southeast of Cuenca.  It is a corn producing area.  Among its attractions we can point out the Cochapamba Lagoon (full of totora reeds).  Its residents are kind and maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.  They are merchants, farmers and raise animals.

Blanca is 35 years old, married and has two children who are 17 and 11 years old.  Her oldest son attends high school and her second daughter attends the local elementary school in the city.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and the house they live in is theirs.

Blanca does the household chores and cares for her family.  Since she spends most of her time at home she also raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs that she sells whenever she has an economic need; they are also for home consumption.

She’s been in the communal bank for 12 years and will use the new loan to buy pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Reyes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REYES” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada donde la señora Ignacia es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chamarras, venta de dulces, venta de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de papa, venta de zapatos, venta de abarrotes.

La señora Ignacia  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su Mamá. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su Tía.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) que comprará de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Ignacia, ya que se tuvo que reincorporara a su negocio de inmediato.
texts.en:
The "Reyes" communal bank will begin its third loan cycle with ProMujer, as part of Centro Sakata. It is made up of eight members, and led by board of directors, of which Ignacia is the secretary. 

The businesses carried on by the members are varied, and include selling jackets, candy, shawls, clothing, food, potatoes, shoes, and groceries. 

Ignacia says that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined at the invitation of her mother. Currently she has a business selling food, that she has been working in for some years, having learned it from her aunt.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital, so that she can purchase foodstuffs that she will buy in La Ceja. After preparing it, she will sell it at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can, since she is in a common-law relationship, and has four children.

When you ask her what he likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes saving.

Ignacia does not appear in the photo, as she had to get back to her business right away.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora en empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen una hija, quien es madre de 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Yolanda es la venta de artesanía, pues su hijo elabora estos objetos en un penal que se encuentra recluido y como parte de un programa de inclusión social, están realizando trabajo artesanles. Dicho adornos los vende a  amistades y a la gente que ofrece de manera ambulante, así logra apoyar a su hijo. Tiene más de 02 años realizando éste negocio. Le gusta este negocio por que siente que está apoyando a su hijo que la necesita, además que con las ganancias de las ventas tiene un ingreso para volverlo a invertir y que su hijo lo gre hacer más objetos artesanales. Ella está ahorrando las ganancias para instalar un taller de fabricación de artesanías en su propia casa, para que su hijo cuando se reintegre a la sociedad pueda dedicarse a ello. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 700 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la implementación del taller que tiene su hijo en el penal, comprando materiales y herramientas para la fabricación de adornos artesanales.
texts.en: Yolanda is 62 years old. She is a hardworking woman with a lot of drive to get ahead. She lives with her partner, with whom she has a daughter with three children of her own. They live together in a house she owns. Yolanda's business is handicrafts sales. Her son makes these crafts at the detention facility where he is currently imprisoned. As part of a social inclusion program, the inmates make craftwork. She sells these ornaments to friends and to people who sell them as a traveling business, so that she can support her son. She has been in this business for over two years. She enjoys it because she feels she is helping her son who needs her. Besides, with the profits from her sales, she gets an income she can invest in order for her son to make more handicrafts. She is saving her profits to set up a handicraft shop in her own house, so that her son can work in it once he's reintegrated into society. This is her first loan with MFP and for that reason she hopes to get your support so that she can continue pursuing her goals. With the requested loan of 700 nuevos soles, she will set up a shop like the one her son has at the detention facility by purchasing tools and supplies to make handicrafted ornaments.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida a concretar sus planes, con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separada de su esposo, pero vive con sus 03 hijos y juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Rita es la  fabricación y venta de artesanías, como masetas y otros objetos. Dicah actividad lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, logrando instalar su pequeño taller en su propia casa, que luego los vende de manera ambulante entre sus amistades, vecinos y público en general. Tiene más de 1 años dedicándose a este oficio y hasta el momento le esta yendo muy bien, además cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano, pues se envarga de hacer la venta. Le agrada su negocio pues le gusta la artesanía, además de las ganancias que le deja puede pagar los gastos de su hogar, ya que con la pensión que le da sus hijos no le alcanza. Ahoea tiene planes de incursionar en la venta de ropa deseando abrir una tienda en alguna zona comercial de su ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropa a precio por mayor de diversas modelos, para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Rita, 32 years old, is a working woman and determined to realize her plans, eager to make progress. She is separated from her husband, but lives with her 3 children in their own home. Rita manufactures and sells handicrafts, such as pots and other objects. She learned this activity in an occupational education center.  She managed to install her small workshop at home and then sells them on a street between friends, neighbors and the general public. She has been devoted to this office for over 1 year and so far is doing very well.  She also has the support of her brother, since he is in charge of making the sale. She likes her business because she likes crafts, plus the earnings let her pay her household expenses, as the pension she gives her children is not enough. Now she has plans to venture into selling clothes, wanting to open a store in a shopping area of the city.  This will be her first loan with the institution MFP therefore she hopes a small loan so that she can meet her goals. With the amount requested of 600 nuevos soles she will invest in buying clothes wholesale, of various models, in order to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes to venture into the sale of clothing.

loans.name: Constructoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Constructoras lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es las señora Martha María de 31 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 2 ½ años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de granos básicos, carne, pollo…etc. Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 14, 8 y 6 años y sus hijas le ayudan en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son  Grethel de 25 años quien vende productos Avon y Mercedes quien tiene un centro de nintendo.
texts.en:
Las Constructoras Group is comprised of three hard-working, enterprising persons.  The coordinator of the group is Martha María.  She is 31 years old and has had a food sales business for two and a half years.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of basic grains, meat, chicken . . . etc. She has four children ages 15, 14, 8, and 6, and her daughters help her with the business.
The other members of the group are Grethel, 25, who sells Avon products and Mercedes who owns a Nintendo center.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en:
Salasitina is thirty-five years of age and is married with one child. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 5 years of experience in this business. Selesitina needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Selesitina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Selesitina's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Fuamoli

texts.en:
Fuamoli is thirty-seven years of age and is married with four children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling soft drinks in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Fuamoli needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the business.

In 2010, Fuamoli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Fuamoli's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and cordials to produce products for sale.

loans.name: Tulai

texts.en:
Tulai is forty-six years of age and is married with four children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Tulai needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to expand the business.

In 2010, Tulai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tulai's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Obabakir

texts.ru: Обабакир мужчина, который занимается куплей и продажей скота. Сам работает в колхозе трактористом, его зарплата не велика всего 200 сомони в месяц.Поэтому он большую часть времени уделяет уходу за скотом. у него сейчас 10 баранов, и из-за зимнего периода у него закончился корм. Он решил на полученный кредит купить несколько мешков корма. А в начале лета планирует получить кредит на увеличение голов скота. Он благодарен всем кредитным организациям , что они дают ему возможность выполнить запланированной цели.
texts.en:
Obabakir is engaged in buying and selling cattle. He works at the kolkhoz (collective farm) as a tractor driver, but his salary is not high, only 200 somoni per month. Therefore, he devotes most of his time to care for livestock. 

Obabakir currently has 10 sheep, and because of the winter season he has no food left for them. He decided to take a loan to buy several sacks of food. At the beginning of the summer he plans to take a loan to increase the number of livestock. He is grateful to the organizations, which give him the opportunity to meet his planned objectives.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Fuigaveve

texts.en:
Fuigaveve is thirty-eight years of age and is married with one child. She owns & operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw materials such as pandana leaves to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 560 talas or US $233 per week) to expand the business.

In 2010, Fuigaveve joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuigaveve's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more pandana leaves to make mats for sale.

loans.name: Maryland

texts.en:
Maryland is eighteen years of age and is married with two children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar and cordials, to produce products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the business.

In 2011, Maryland joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Maryland's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar and cordials, to produce products for sale.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is from Malibangacao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and married with six children. 

To make a living, Conchita is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community, such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. She has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,620 PHP a month for these activities.

Conchita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital to purchase products to resell. In 2007, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Avefua

texts.en:
Avefua is forty-eight years old and is married with ten children.

Avefua owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Avefua needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and cordials so she can make products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 350 or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Avefua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Avefua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and cordials, in order to produce products to sell.

loans.name: Faapaolo

texts.en:
Fapaolo is thirty-three years of age and is married with two children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Faapaolo needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase items so that she can make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 500 or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Faapaolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faapaolo's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase items such as pandana leaves and chicken feathers so she can make products to sell.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is forty-seven years of age and is married with three children.

Sesilia owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Sesilia needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 350 or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Sesilia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sesilia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with six children. Erlinda is 61 years old, and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Erlinda owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting cassava for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for ten years and earns PHP 2,000 a month from it. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Erlinda has been a member of GDMPC since 2006. In the future, Erlinda wants to make improvements to her house and be successful in business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn

texts.en:
Bunthoeurn, 57, is married, resides with his wife and three children in Kampong Chhang Province, Cambodia. He is a staff of the Art and Cultural Department. His wife is a homemaker. All of his children are employed; two are staff of the governor and another one is employed in a bank. 

In order to improve his family finances, Bunthoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to set up a grocery store for his wife to run from their home. This will generate extra income to support the family. In the future, he would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his wife to sell at home.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
At the age of 19, Precy is already married. She has one child. She lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Precy manages a gardening business as their source of living. She has been in this business for two years and earns PHP 1,500 a month. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

Recently, she joined GDMPC to seek assistance and help her finance her business. She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman and she has three children. She is 32 years old and resides at Trigos, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.  

Marilou owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 from this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Marilou has been a member of GDMPC for almost six years. In the future, Marilou wants to make improvements to her house and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from Catadman, Ozamis City. She is 51 years old. Editha is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture, making and selling a variety of snacks goods in the local community. Editha has been in her business for two years and earns 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Editha is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Editha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Faalulugaina

texts.en:
Faalulugaina is thirty-four years of age and is married with two children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Faalulugaina needs a loan of WST 1,500 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 150 or US $63 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Faalulugaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faalulugaina's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Estrelieta

texts.en:
Estrelieta is 30 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Estrelieta has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. Estrelieta requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics and other personal products.

Estrelieta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Estrelieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfumes, body lotions, cosmetics and other personal products.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Guillerma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Soul

texts.en:
Soul, 52, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over twenty years and is successful in her career. Additionally, she runs a grocery store from home to generate more income for the family. All of her children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a policeman. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions and generate extra profits to support the family, Soul is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to run one more business by purchasing rice to resell at the rice mill. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-four years of age and is married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of confectionery  such cookies and cakes in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Mary Olepa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase an additional oven for baking. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 250 or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business. Mary Olepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.
