Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mary Olepa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an additional oven for baking.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 43 years old, married and has five children in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Luz has a food stall selling inasal or barbecued foods in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Luz has been in this business for five years. In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has four children. She is 41 years old, and resides in Tabid, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alma owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas which she sells to earn a living. She's been in this business for seven years and makes PHP 2,000 a month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Alma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en:
Emilita is from Calabayan Ozamis City. She is 46 years old. Emilita is married.

To make a living, Emilita owns and operates a business venture, making and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Emilita has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

Emilita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She became a member of GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Saala

texts.en:
Saala is 36 years of age and married. She has four children.

Saala owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has four years of experience in this business.    

Saala needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase raw products such as flour and sugar as well as an additional oven to help with the baking. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 WST or US $83 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Saala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Saala's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw products such as flour and sugar as well as an additional oven to help with baking.

loans.name: Theany

texts.en:
Theany, 27, is widowed. She resides with her mother and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a grocery store for over three years and is successful in her career. Her mother helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family economy, Theany is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more groceries to sell to generate more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business, renew her house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Leona has a food shop or carenderia that makes and sells viands like afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for 18 years. 

She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

Leona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married and has three children. She is 39 years old and resides at Bacolod Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Arlyn plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Recently, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

In the future, Arlyn wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 22 years old and lives in Pan-ay,Clarin. She is married and has two children. 

Arlene has a shop that sells clothes. She has had this business for three years. 

Arlene requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes items.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes items.

loans.name: Januaria

texts.en:
Januaria is 55 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Januaria is married and has seven children. 

Januaria has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 15 years. 

Januaria has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Januaria has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Januaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Candelyn

texts.en:
Candelyn is 39 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez. She is married and has two children.
 
Candelyn has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years. 

Candelyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Candelyn has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Candelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from Calabayan Ozamis City. She is 59 years old. Carmen is married and has eight children. To make a living, Carmen makes & sells a variety of snack foods in the local community. Carmen has been in her business for two years and earns 1,900 PHP a month for these activities. 

Carmen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Recently, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman having one child. Victoria is 42 years old, residing at Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Victoria owns & operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish in the local community to earn a living and she's been eight years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2011, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Victoria wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 44 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez. Lily is widowed with three children. 

Lily has a shop that sells different ready-to-wear clothes. Lily has had this business for five years. Lily requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing items.

Lily has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Lily hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing items.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon, 55, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Two of her children are employed; one is a battery charger and another one runs a business repairing motorbikes. 

In order to improve her family livelihood, Mon is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as to repair for his customers. In the future, she would like to expand her son's business, renew her home, and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell or repair for his customers.

loans.name: Josefina Nina

texts.en:
Josefina Nina is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Josefina Nina has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Josefina Nina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Josefina Nina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is twenty-seven years of age and is married with three children.

Tina owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Tina needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase frozen goods or meat such as mutton, chicken, and sausages to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 850 talas or US $354 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tina's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase frozen goods or meat such as mutton, chicken, and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Donnabelle

texts.en:
Donnabelle is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Donnabelle is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed, hogs and fertilizer.

Donnabelle has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, hogs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sa Un

texts.en:
Sa Un, 53, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband has been a primary school teacher for twenty years. Additionally, he is a motor mechanic. Her two daughters are garment workers. Two of her sons are construction workers. 

 In order to improve her family economy, Sa Un is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as to use to repair motorbikes for his customers. In the future, she would like to open a car-washing shop for her children to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as  to use to repair motorbikes for his customers.

loans.name: Romenchie

texts.en:
Romenchie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Romenchie has a tailoring shop where she makes & sells office uniforms, school uniforms & dresses. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Romenchie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Romenchie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Jenner

texts.en:
Jenner has a general store that sells a variety of products. Jenner has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Jenner has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Jenner hopes to expand his business.

Jenner is 44 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin. He is married with three children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Mercedita has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is forty years old, married, and has six children.

Elisapeta owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Elisapeta needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Elisapeta's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en:
Tolotea is thirty-five years of age and is married with four children.

Tolotea owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Tolotea needs a loan of WST 1,400 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tolotea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Tolotea's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Eim

texts.en: Eim, 28, is married and lives with her mother, her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a construction worker. Due to low income, Eim is requesting for a loan of $500 US to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice. She wants to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and support her children's studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 58 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with 6 children. 

Victoriana has a general store that sells different spices. She has had this business for 20 years. Victoriana has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional spices to sell.

Victoriana has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Mary Grace has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en:
Sarangerel, 48, is a shoe seller. She lives with her family in the ger district in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Sarangerel sells her shoes in a bazaar in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business for 7 years and she has many permanent customers. The Lunar Year is approaching. It is a traditional and respectful Mongolian celebration. The demand for commodities such as shoes will increase notably during these days. Therefore, she wants to prepare her commodities in advance of the celebration, which is a big opportunity for merchants. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing shoes in large quantities in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of shoes to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en:
Aleja is 59 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with 2 adult children. 

Aleja buys and sells jewelry, earning approximately PHP 12,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to purchase stocks of jewelry for her business.

Aleja has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Gema has a shop where she sells fish such as sardines and trout. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fish to sell.

Gema has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Adelfa Group

texts.en:
Adelfa is married with 2 children. She is 30 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Adelfa is a farmer and she raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Adelfa has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional feed for her livestock.

Adelfa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. Adelfa is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business. In the future, Adelfa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for raising livestock.

loans.name: Sarors

texts.en:
Sarors, 43, is married. She resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband has been a blacksmith for over twenty years and is successful in his career. Two of her children sell clothes in the market in Thailand. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Sarors is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her children's business so they can purchase more clothes to sell. By doing so, they would generate more profits to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her children's business and support her youngest child in getting a more advanced education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu owns and operates a business venture selling soft drinks in the local community. She is 67 years old and married with five children. Fatu has three years of experience in her business. She needs a loan of 2,000 talas (WST) to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2009, Fatu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Fatu's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para Mejor Futuro Group

texts.en:
Lorenza is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres unidas para un futuro mejor (women unite for a better future). She lives in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to get capital to start a business and to build her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying attending church.

Lorenza is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, where she sells jewelry, by purchasing rings, bracelets, necklaces, and other women's accessories.  She will start her business with this loan, and she is exciting to work and develop her business. She will use her business profits to reinvest in her business.

Lorenza lives in a zone of little resources in the city of Santiago, which is one of the most populated in the Dominican Republic.  She is a very hard worker and an enthusiastic woman.  Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy jewelery.

loans.name: Sari Usaha Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is applying for a new loan to continue her business. Currently, the schools of her children will cost quite a lot because it is near the exam. Doing her pig-raising business greatly helps to meet those costs. 

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy three superior piglets with feed purchased with her own money from last period's profit. She hopes that in the next six months her business will run smoothly so that it can pay for school fees.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets.

loans.name: Tauavae

texts.en:
Tauavae is twenty-four years of age and is married with four children.

Tauavae  owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Tauavae  needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Tauavae  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tauavae 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is thirty years old and is married with two children.

Ruta  owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Ruta  needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Ruta  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ruta 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Faatoina

texts.en:
Faatoina is thirty-seven years of age and is married with seven children.

Faatoina owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Faatoina needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Faatoina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is faatoina's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Он с детства приучен к физическому труду. Пять лет назад они с отцом начали  дехканское хозяйство. Трудно было начинать бизнес, были долги . В прошлом году они собрали хороший урожай  хлопка и получили хорошую прибыль, улучшили благосостояние семьи. К сожалению этот год стал неудачным, большая конкуренция, плохое сырье, низкие цены на сельхозпродукции. Он вынужден был искать дополнительные финансовые источники для покупки семян лука и картофеля, потому что он не продал свой урожай и они останутся до того, когда цены поднимутся.
texts.en: Firdavs is married and is a loving father of two children.  He has been used to physical labor since childhood.  He and his father started a dekhan farm five years.  It was difficult to start the business, and they had debts.  Last year, they gathered a good harvest of cotton and made a good profit, and improved their family's welfare.  Unfortunately, this year turned out to be unlucky.  There was a lot of competition, bad raw materials and low prices for agricultural crops.  Firdavs had to find additional financial sources to purchase onion and potato seeds because he did not sell his harvest, which he will keep until the prices increase.

loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut wants to increase her business by raising local pigs for pig roll [roast suckling pig]. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and feed. Pigs for pig roll are usually only kept for two to three months and then sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her feed the pigs and clean the barn. Ni Ketut will save her profit because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen. 

Ni Ketut is on the left in the front row holding a green book.

loans.use: to purchase three local piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's and men's pants, fine blouses and sports tops, clothes for children, spandex clothes, underclothes for men and women, baby clothes, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 45-year-old married woman with 3 children; 2 attend school while the other completed school. Her husband Gabriel is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Martha has operated a dry fish selling business for the past 6 years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 44,892 she wants to purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 38-year-old married woman with 6 children; 3 of whom attend school while the rest are married. Her husband Mtengo is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanajuma has operated a juice (soft drinks) selling business for the past 3 years; her potential clients are her neighbors and students from the local school. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of sugar. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase a freezer for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it has fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Dorice is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. She is age 25 and married with three children, with the firstborn already schooling. She has been in farming for 7 years and employs one farmhand. Her farm products, like milk, maize, beans and vegetables, are being sold locally.

Dorice has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will increase her milk output both for family consumption and income generation. She emphasizes that farming has been her sole source of income for the 7 years she has been married. She aspires to grow in it and give her children better standards of living.

Dorice, however, notes that animal diseases and market price fluctuation are great limitations to the farming business.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow
